title: Dainandini
description:
अतिजीवति वित्तेन सुखं जीवति विद्यया।
किंचिज्जीवति शिल्पेन ऋते कर्म न जीवति॥
One lives in superabundance when one has wealth; one lives happily by learning; one lives in a normal manner by skills; but one does not live at all when there is no work to do.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिक्रान्तं तु यः कार्यं पश्चाच्चिन्तयते नरः।
तच्चास्य न भवेत् कार्यं चिन्तया तु विनश्यति॥
The man who broods over past matters not only loses their results but also is destroyed by worry.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिकुपिता अपि सुजना योगेन मृदूभवन्ति न तु नीचाः।
हेम्नः कठिनस्यापि द्रवणोपायोऽस्ति न तृणानाम्॥
A good man's exceeding anger can be calmed by some means, but not so of a mean person. Though hard, gold can be melted but not grass.

title: Committee members from Central Sanskrit University, Delhi visit KSRI
description: On 23rd October, 2024, the committee members from Central Sanskrit University, Delhi visited KSRI & interacted with the faculty & research scholars of the Institute. They also visited the Library and glanced through the publications of KSRI.

title: Committee members from Central Sanskrit University, Delhi visit KSRI
description: On 23rd October, 2024, the committee members from Central Sanskrit University, Delhi visited KSRI & interacted with the faculty & research scholars of the Institute. They also visited the Library and glanced through the publications of KSRI.

title: Dainandini
description:
एकेन राजहंसेन या शोभा सरसो भवेत्।
न सा बक सहस्रेण परितस्तीरवासिना॥
The beauty and charm that ponds have in the presence of just one royal swan is not attained even by the presence of thousands of cranes living all around the lake.

title: The Pontiff of Uttaradi Mutt  visited KSRI
description: The Pontiff of Uttaradi Mutt visited our institute on  17 October 2024 at 4 p.m. He evinced keen interest in our publications, library and reading some books and palm leaf manuscripts.

title: Dainandini
description:
उत्साह सम्पन्नमदीर्घसूत्रं
क्रिया विधिज्ञं व्यसनेष्वसक्तम्।
शूरं कृतज्ञं दृढसौहृदं च
लक्ष्मीः स्वयं याति निवास हेतोः॥
Goddess Lakṣmī or wealth is attracted to one who is endowed with enthusiasm; who does not procrastinate, who plans his actions and executes them as per the plan, who is not overwhelmed with offerings, who is valarous, never forgets the timely help rendered by others and who has loyal friends.

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्योगे नास्ति दारिद्र्यं जपतो नास्ति पातकम्।
मौने च कलहो नास्ति नास्ति जागरितो भयम् ॥
When there is hard work there is no poverty; chanting of mantras dissolves one's sins; by observing silence there is no quarrel and there is no fear when one is alert.

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुरप्यसतां सङ्गः सद्गुणं हन्ति विस्तृतम्।
गुणरूपान्तरं याति तक्रयोगाद्यथा पयः॥
A large quantity of milk undergoes a transformation of getting mixed up with a little buttermilk. Hence, a little association with the wicked destroys good qualities in abundance.

title: 166th  Annual Convocation of University of Madras
description:
The 166th Annual Convocation Ceremony was celebrated at the University of Madras on 24/09/2024. The following scholars from the KSRI, received their Ph.D. Degree Certificate from the Hon'ble Tamil Nadu Governor, Mr. R.N. Ravi. 
1.  Dr. S. Madhurambika
2. Dr. N. Bhuvaneswari 
3. Dr. S.Goda Devi 
4. Dr. K. Srikkanth
5.  Dr. S. Balakrishnan
6. Dr. S. Renganayaki

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानं खलु कष्टम् क्रोधादिभ्योऽपि सर्वपापेभ्यः।
अर्थं हितमहितं वा न वेत्ति येनावृतो लोकः॥
Ignorance is a great evil, greater than all the vices like anger and so on; a man confined in it does not know a good object from a bad.

title: Sanskrit Radio Talks - KSRI faculty sing the praise (spread the colours) of Sanskrit at Akashvani Chennai!
description:
The All India Radio - Akashvani Chennai, invited the faculty of KSRI to deliver radio talks for the "Samskrita Nigazhchi" ( Sanskrit" programme) - a specially curated programme that focuses on bringing to light various hidden treasures of Sanskrit  to the public via the tamil language. This 15-min programme is aired  every tuesday at 2.45pm.

The details of the talks that were broadcasted are given below:
 1) Dr. V Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director, The KSRI - 23rd & 30th July, 2024.
a) काव्येषु मङ्गल श्लोकाः - part 1; b) part 2
2) Dr. P.C.Muralidharan, Asst. Professor, The KSRI. – 20th & 27th August, 2024.
 a) மழையின் கணிப்பு-பராசரரின் பார்வையில்; b) விதையின் பயன்பாடு - பராசரரின் பார்வையில்
3) Dr. V Annapurna, Research Associate, The KSRI - 17th and 24th September
a)வடமொழியில் இரசாயன நூல்கள் மற்றும் ஆய்வுக்கூட அமைப்பு part ; b) part 2

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञं कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति तज्ञ्ज्ञं कर्म न लिम्पति।
लिप्यते रसनैवैका सर्पिषा करवद् यथा॥
All the works hang heavily only on the ignorant person but not so on proficient one. Ghee sticks to the palm but not to the tongue.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठा भूतानां प्रज्ञा लाभः परो मतः।
प्रज्ञा निःश्रेयसो लोके प्रज्ञा स्वर्गो मतस्सताम्॥
Knowledge is the basis for beings; knowledge is considered the greatest acquisition; knowledge is the greatest happpiness in the world; knowledge is considered by the good as heaven.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्जितं स्वेन वीर्येण नान्यपाश्रित्य कञ्चन।
फलशाकमपि श्रेयो भोक्तुं ह्यकृपणं गृहे॥
One (should not touch) the things those are not earned by his own valour or not depending on others; it is better to eat even fruits or vegetables in his own house unhindered by dejection.

title: Dainandini
description:
अजानता भवेत्कश्चिद् अपराधः कुतो यदि।
क्षन्तव्यमेव तस्याहुः सुपरीक्ष्य परीक्षया॥
People who have analysed the problem well, declare that one has to forgive a person who has insulted without knowledge.

title: Dainandini
description:
अजरामरवत् प्राज्ञो विद्यामर्थं च चिन्तयेत्।
गृहीत इव केशेषु मृत्युना धर्ममाचरेत्॥
A wise man should fix his thoughts upon knowledge and wealth as if he were immortal and eternal and he should practice his duties as if he were seized by the hairs of his head by death.

title: Dainandini
description:
अग्नौ प्राप्तं प्रधूयेत यथा तूलं द्विजोत्तम।
तथा गङ्गावगाढस्य सर्वं पापं प्रधूयते॥
Just as cotton when it comes into contact with fire, is burnt off without any trace, likewise the sins of men are washed off without any trace when he bathes in the river Ganges.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं वेदेषु जागर्ति फलं सत्ये परं स्मृतम्।
सत्याद् धर्मो दमश्चैव सर्वं सत्ये प्रतिष्ठितम्॥
Truth is awake in the Vedas. The fruit attached to truth has been described as the highest. From truth originate righteousness and self-control. Everything is established in truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
ईश्वराणां वचःसत्यं तथैवाचरितं क्वचित्।
तेषां यत्स्ववचोयुक्तं बुद्धिमांस्तत्समाचरेत्॥
The statements of the Lord's empowered disciples are always true, and the acts they perform are exemplary when it is consistent with those statements. Therefore one who is intelligent should carry out their instructions. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.33.32)

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा खनन् खनित्रेण नरो वार्यधिगच्छति।
तथा गुरुगतां विद्यां शुश्रूषुरधिगच्छति॥
Just as a person who digs with a spade gets water, a student with his obedience obtains knowledge from his teacher.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रायेण श्रीमतां लोके भोक्तुं शक्तिर्न विद्यते।
काष्ठान्यपि हि जीर्यन्ते दरिद्राणां च सर्वश:॥
It is very common in this world that rich men have no appetite while the poor can digest even pieces of wood.

title: Dainandini
description:
इन्द्रियाणि जयन्त्याशु निराहारा मनीषिणः।
वर्जयित्वा तु रसनं तन्निरन्नस्य वर्धते॥
If one artificially tries to give up sense gratification, especially that of the tongue, the attempt will be a failure, and in fact one's desire for sense gratification will increase as a result of artificial deprivation. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रायेण श्रीमतां लोके भोक्तुं शक्तिर्न विद्यते।
काष्ठान्यपि हि जीर्यन्ते दरिद्राणां च सर्वश:॥
It is very common in this world that rich men have no appetite while the poor can digest even pieces of wood.

title: Dainandini
description:
नाभिषेको न संस्कार: सिंहस्य क्रियते मृगै:।
विक्रमार्जितराज्यस्य स्वयमेव मृगेन्द्रता॥
The animals do not perform any coronation or ritual for the lion to be a king but he earns the Lordship over the jungle-kingdom through his bravery.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं ब्रह्म तपः सत्यं सत्यं विसृजते प्रजाः।
सत्येन धार्यते लोकः स्वर्गं सत्येन गच्छति॥
Truth is Brahma; truth is penance, it is truth which creates all creatures. The world is governed by truth and one goes to heavens by (adhering to) truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं दुःखस्यानन्तरं सुखम्।
न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम्॥
Sorrow comes after happiness and happiness after sorrow. One does not always suffer sorrow or always enjoy happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं दुःखस्यानन्तरं सुखम्।
न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम्॥
Sorrow comes after happiness and happiness after sorrow. One does not always suffer sorrow or always enjoy happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्योगिनं पुरुषसिंहमुपैति लक्ष्मीः
दैवं हि दैन्यमिति कापुरुषाः वदन्ति।
दैवं निहत्य कुरु पौरुषमात्मशक्त्या
यत्ने कृते यदि न सिध्यति कोऽत्र दोषः॥
Wealth always reaches only those lion-like people who persistently keep trying and continuously toil. But some people consider poverty and misery as fate. One can overcome fate through continuous efforts. Even after trying hard, if one does not succeed, one should find out where the fault lies.

title: Dainandini
description:
आचारः कुलमाख्याति देशमाख्याति भाषणम्।
सम्भ्रमः स्नेहमाख्याति वपुराख्याति भोजनम् ॥
The good conduct of a person reveals the lineage; his language reveals his nationality; the way one receives the guest reveals his love; and one's physical form reveals the nature and the quality of food he consumes.

title: Dainandini
description:
आपत्सु मित्रं जानीयात् युद्धे शूरमृणे शुचिम्।
भार्यां क्षीणेषु वित्तेषु व्यसनेषु च बान्धवम्॥
One can know a true friend during the time of crisis; a person's bravery in the battle field; honesty in the manner he returns his loan; a spouse in the way she behaves during financial crisis; and the true nature of relatives at the time of calamity.

title: Dainandini
description:
नाधनो धर्मकृत्यानि यथावदनुतिष्ठति।
धनाद्धि धर्मो निस्रौति शैलाद्गिरिनदी यथा॥
The man who has no wealth cannot carry out religious acts, for these originate from wealth, like rivers from a mountain.

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्यायोपार्जितं वित्तं दशवर्षाणि तिष्ठति ।
प्राप्ते चैकादशे वर्षे समूलञ्च विनश्यति ॥
The wealth, earned through dishonest and unfair means may last for a short period of ten years. Later the ill-gotten money will vanish in totality.

title: Dainandini
description:
अहो दैन्यमहो कष्टं पारक्यैः क्षणभंगुरैः।
यन्नोपकुर्यादस्वार्थैर्मर्त्यः स्वज्ञातिविग्रहैः॥
The body which is actually consumed by jackals and dogs after my death, does no good for me. It is perishable, and can be used only for a short time. The body, its possessions, it's riches and relatives should be used for the benefit of uplifting others. Else, they will be sources of tribulations and misery.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam VI.10.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
अनार्यमार्यवृत्तेन सत्येनानृतवादितम्।
रिपुमप्युपकारेण वशीकुर्वन्ति साधव:॥
Good people win over the bad souls by their good conduct; untruthful with truth and even the enemies by favouring them.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयुः श्रियं यशो धर्म लोकानाशिष एव च।
हन्ति श्रेयांसि सर्वाणि पुंसो महदतिक्रमः॥
When a man abuses great souls, his blessings of longevity, beauty, fame, dharma and promotion to higher pursuits of life will be destroyed. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.4.46)

title: Dainandini
description:
उत्साहसम्पन्नमदीर्घसूत्रं क्रियाविधिज्ञं व्यसनेष्वसक्तम्।
शूरं कृतज्ञं दृढसौहृदं च लक्ष्मीस्वयं याति निवासहेतुः॥
Goddess Lakshmi resides in one – who is energetic, who does not procrastinate, who knows the theory and practice of a thing, who is not addicted to vices, who is brave, grateful and is firm in friendship.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्थेनापि विहीनस्य पुरुषस्याल्पचेतसः।
विच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियास्सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा॥
All acts of a person, who endowed with little intelligence allows himself to be divested of wealth, are all dried up like shallow rivers in the summer.

title: Dainandini
description:
अल्पानामपि वस्तूनां संहति: कार्यसाधिका ।
तृणैर्गुणस्वमापन्नैर्बध्यन्ते मत्तदन्तिन:॥
The union of even small things leads to the accomplishment of an object; infuriated elephants are tied down by means of grass twisted into a rope.

title: Dainandini
description:
आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचाराल्लभते श्रियम्।
आचारात् कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च॥
Longevity can be accomplished through good conduct and so does the wealth; Similarly fame is attained by a person here and hereafter too.

title: Dainandini
description:
असतः श्रीमदान्धस्य दारिद्र्यं परमञ्जनम्।
आत्मौपम्येन भूतानि दरिद्रः परमीक्षते॥
Atheists, who are very proud of their wealth, fail to see things as they are. Therefore, making them poor is the suitable ointment to their eyes, so they may see things as they are. At least, a man who is struck by poverty can realise how painful it is, therefore, will not want others to be in a painful condition like his own. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam X.10.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
नास्ति विद्यासमं चक्षुर्नास्ति सत्यसमं तपः।
नास्ति रागसमं दुःखं नास्ति त्यागसमं सुखम्॥
There is no eye equal to learning, no penance equal to truth, no misery like passion, no happiness like sacrifice.

title: Dainandini
description:
मुक्तानुगुणवृत्तानां भजतां पावनीं गतिम्।
नित्यं विष्णुपदे वृत्तिस्तारकाणां सितात्मनाम्॥
Men, who follow the sacred path having renounced their worldly pleasures, pure in their heart with noble nature, helping their fellow beings in crossing the ocean of samsara, are always seen being engaged upon contemplating the lotus feet of Lord and uttering his names. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.6.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
आगमिष्यन्ति ते भावा ये भावा मयि भाविनः।
अहं तैरनुसर्तव्यो न तेषामन्यतो गतिः॥
Whatever destiny written for me would reach me certainly. I shall be followed by it; its course cannot be altered in a different way.

title: Dainandini
description:
बोद्धारो मत्सरग्रस्ताः प्रभवः स्मयदूषिताः।
अबोधोपहताश्चान्ये जीर्णमङ्गे सुभाषितम्॥
The learned ones are jealous, kings are spoiled because of arrogance, the rest are ignorant, hence wise sayings perish in the body itself.

title: Dainandini
description:
अरयोऽपि हि संधेयाः सति कार्यार्थगौरवे।
अहिमूषकवद्देवा ह्यर्थस्य पदवीं गतैः॥
O Devas, fulfilling one's interest is so important that you may have to enter into a treaty with your enemies. For the sake of upholding one's interest, one has to use the logic of the snake and the mouse (Srīmad Bhāgavatam VII.6.20).

title: Dainandini
description:
रूपयौवनसंपन्ना: विशालकुलसंभवा:।
विद्याहीना: न शोभन्ते निर्गन्धा: इव किंशुका:॥
Those who are uneducated do not shine even if they are endowed with beauty and youth and are born in renowned families just like kimśuka flowers which are beautiful but odourless.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयु: कर्म च वित्तञ्च विद्या निधनमेव च।
पञ्चैते ननु कल्प्यन्ते गर्भगत्वेन देहिनाम्॥
Longevity, deeds, prosperity, knowledge and death of a person are decided even while he is in the mother's womb.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्थेनापि विहीनस्य पुरुषस्याल्पचेतसः।
विच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियास्सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा॥
All acts of a person, who endowed with little intelligence allows himself to be divested of wealth, are all dried up like shallow rivers in the summer.

title: Dainandini
description:
आकल्यात् आनिशीथाश्च कुक्ष्यर्थं व्याप्रियामहे।
न च निर्वृणुमो जातु शान्तास्तु सुखमासते॥
Despite striving hard from dawn to dusk for the sake of belly, could not accomplish contentment unlike the ones steeped in tranquillity.

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवा ज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनाम यत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघं पुंसो दहेदेधो यथानलः॥
Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.2.18)

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्प: क्रूर: खल: क्रूर: सर्पात्क्रूरतर: खल:।
मन्त्रोषधवश: सर्प: किमुदुष्टो भयङ्कर:॥
The snake and the wicked person are both dangerous. The poison of a snake can be neutralized by mantra or medicine while there is no mantra or medicine that can remove the poison of a wicked person.

title: Dainandini
description:
यदा न कुरुते धीरः सर्वभूतेषु पापकम्।
कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते परम्॥
When a man of wisdom does not commit sin against any being, in act, mind or speech, he becomes the Supreme Brahman.

title: Dainandini
description:
पुत्रा इव पितुर्गेहे विषये यस्य मानवाः।
निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति स राजा राजसत्तमः॥
That king is the best king in whose country, the people move without fear, like sons in their father's house.

title: Dainandini
description:
यदा न कुरुते धीरः सर्वभूतेषु पापकम्।
कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते परम्॥
When a man of wisdom does not commit sin against any being, in act, mind or speech, he becomes the Supreme Brahman.

title: Dainandini
description:
पुत्रा इव पितुर्गेहे विषये यस्य मानवाः।
निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति स राजा राजसत्तमः॥
That king is the best king in whose country, the people move without fear, like sons in their father's house.

title: 75th ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATIONS -  VALEDICTORY FUNCTION
description:
The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is celebrating its 75th anniversary. To commemorate this milestone the Institute organized various National Workshops, Seminars and Lectures on various subjects like Bhakti, Art& Architecture, Sanskrit Literature, Ancient Indian Mathematics and Astronomy. 
The Valedictory Function of the 75th Anniversary Celebrations will be celebrated on 13th Sepetember, 2024 at 5.00pm at The Madras Sanskrit College Premises.

Dr. N. Gopalaswami IAS(Retd.) will preside over the function and release the book "ŚEṢASAMHITĀ" and honor the prominent donors.

Dr. S. Ramaratnam , Chancellor, Jagadguru Kripalu University, Odisha will deliver the Valedictory address.

गुरुर्न स स्यात्स्वजनो न स स्यात्
पिता न स स्याज्जननी न सा स्यात्।
दैवं न तत्स्यान्न पतिश्च स स्यात्
न मोचयेद्यः समुपेत मृत्युम्॥
One who cannot help his devotees cross the repeated cycle of birth and death can neither become a Guru, a relative, a father, a mother, a demigod nor a husband. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 5.5.18)

title: Assistant Professors and Research Scholars of KSRI presented papers in the Seminar on "Minor Deities in Indian Art"  at the C.P.R.  Centre
description: On 28th of March 2024, Assistant Professors, Dr. V Preethi and Dr. P.C. Muralidharan along with Research Scholar V.R. Srinivasan participated and presented Research articles at the Seminar on "Minor Deities in Indian Art"  organised by the C.P.R. Institute of Indological Research, Chennai.

title: Assistant Professor of KSRI was invited to Judge a  competition at the Ramakrishna Mission Vivekananda College,  Chennai
description: Dr. V. Preethi, Asst. Prof., Assistant Professor of The KSRI, Chennai, was  a judge for the Annual Intercollegiate  competitions  organised by Sanskrit Department, Ramakrishna Mission Vivekananda College, Chennai on 24th of January 2024.

title: Dr. P.C.Muralidharan, Asst. Prof., KSRI presented a paper at the Two day National Seminar on Kumarasambhavamimamsa
description: The Madras Sanskrit college conducted a Two day National Seminar on Kumarasambhavamimamsa on 30th & 31st March 2024. Dr. P.C.Muralidharan, Asst. Prof., KSRI presented a paper titled " Kumārasambhave Rativilāpa"

title: Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 07.05.2024 at the KSRI
description: Ph. D. candidate Mr. S Balakrishnan, under the supervision of Dr. T.V. VASUDEVA, (M.A., Ph.D.), Deputy Director, The KSRI,   defended his thesis on "RATNASAṄGRAHAḤ OF ŚRĪ RAGHUNĀTHĀCĀRYA: CRITICAL EDITION AND STUDY" at the Institute premises on 7th May 2024.
content: Mr. S Balakrishnan

title: Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 22.05.2024 at the KSRI
description: Ph.D. candidate Mrs. S. RENGANAYAKI, under the supervision of Dr. V. Kameswari, Former Director of The KSRI, defended her thesis on "SŪRYA IN SANSKRIT LITERATURE VIS-A-VIS MODERN CONCEPTS" at the Institute premises on May 22, 2024.

title: New Innings of KSRI
description: After the severe 2023 floods...... 12th April 2024 - Pooja - Ganapati homa Navagraha Homa

title: Director of The KSRI was awarded ' The Sri Sai Puraskar '
description: On 2nd December 2023, Shri Sanjay Sai Sewa Organisations International, Tamil Nadu Chapter celebrated Sri Sai Puraskar Utsav at RMT Clubhouse Hall, Chennai and awarded VIPS of Excellence in Arts and Philanthrophy. Dr. K. S. Balasubramanian, Director of the KSR Institute received the  'The Sri Sai Puraskar' award.

title: Deputy Director of The KSRI, invited as a guest speaker by SASTRA University,  Thanjavur.
description:
On 24th January 2024, The Department of Oriental Studies (DOSR), SASTRA University, Thanjavur,  organised a Lecture Series on account of World Philosophy day.  
Dr. V. Yamuna Devi,  Deputy Director of The KSRI was invited as a guest speaker and she  delivered a lecture on " Thoughts of Science and Technology in Indian Philosophical Systems."

title: Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director of The KSRI delivered a lecture on  'Nature Preservation Methods'  at the Justice Basheer Ahmed Sayeed College for Women
description: The Sanskrit Department of Justice Basheer Ahmed Sayeed College for Women, Chennai conducted a Seminar on 'Nature Preservation - The bygone ways & Ayurveda - The ancient medical Science' on 29th February 2024. Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director of The KSRI delivered the lecture on  'Nature Preservation Methods'.

title: Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Deputy Director of The KSRI, was invited as a resource person to enlighten the teachers of Amrita Vidyalayam, Tiruchirapalli
description: Amrita Vidyalayam Tamilnadu and Pondicherry  organised a 3 day Annual teacher's Cultural Education Camp from 29th April onwards at Amrita Vidyalayam Tiruchirapalli. On 30th April 2024, Dr. V. Yamuna Devi,  Deputy Director of The KSRI  delivered a lecture on "Dharma of every Bharatiya: Sanatana Dharma"

title: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature in Sanskrit and Tamil – Valediction on 25.11.2023
description: The valedictory function of the two-day National Seminar on Bhakti Literature in Sanskrit and Tamil was held on 25.11.2023 at 3.30 pm.   Dr C.L. Ramakrishnan, Former Director, Dept. of Vigilance and Anti-corruption, delivered the Valedictory address under Justice N Rajagopala Ayyangar Endowment.

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्यायोपार्जितं वित्तं दशवर्षाणि तिष्ठति ।
प्राप्ते चैकादशे वर्षे समूलञ्च विनश्यति ॥
The wealth, earned through dishonest and unfair means may last for a short period of ten years. Later the ill-gotten money will vanish in totality.

title: Dainandini
description:
कौमार आचरेत्प्राज्ञो धर्मान् भागवतानिह।
दुर्लभं मानुषं जन्म तदप्यध्रुवमर्थदम्॥
One must utilise the human birth from the very beginning of his childhood in activities of devotional service, giving up other desires. A human birth is very rare to achieve, and although the human birth is also temporary, it gives us an opportunity to practice devotion. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 7.6.1)

title: Dainandini
description:
अनुव्रतानां शिष्याणां पुत्राणां च द्विजोत्तम |
अनापृष्टमपिब्रूयुर्गुरवो दीनवत्सलाः॥
O Blessed one! Spiritual masters are very kind to the needy people, to their disciples, and to their sons, and impart all that is known to them, without being asked. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam 3.7.36)

title: Dainandini
description:
किं प्रमत्तस्य बहुभिः परोक्षैर्हार्यनैरिह।
वरं मुहूर्तं विदितं घटेत श्रेयसे यतः॥
What is the use of a prolonged life which is wasted and inexperienced? Better, is a moment of absolute consciousness, which takes us on the path of realising the eternal truth. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 2.1.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
किं दुर्मर्षं तितिक्षूणां किमकार्यमसाधुभिः।
किं न देयं वदान्यानां कः परः समदर्शिनाम् ॥
What can a tolerant person not bear? What can a wicked person not scheme? What will a generous person not give in charity? And who will those with samabhäva (equal vision) see as an outsider? (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.72.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
किं विद्यया किं तपसा किं त्यागेन श्रुतेन वा।
किं विविक्तेन मौनेन स्त्रीभिर्यस्य मनोहृतम् ॥
What is the use of education, penance, renunciation, studying of scriptures, or living in solitude in silence, if one's mind is stolen by a woman? (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 11.26.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
कालो बलीयान्बलिनां भगवानीश्वरोऽव्ययः।
प्रजाः कालयते क्रीडन्पशुपालो यथा पशून्॥
Inexhaustible time, which is stronger than the strong, is the Supreme Personality of God. Like a herdsman who moves his animals along, he moves mortal creatures as his Divine play. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.51.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
कर्मणा जायते जन्तुः कर्मणैव निलीयते।
सुखं दुःखं भयं क्षेमं कर्मणैवाभिपद्यते॥
It is by the Law of Karma that a living being takes birth, and it is by Karma alone, that a living being meets his destruction. His happiness, sorrow, fear, and sense of security arise as the effects of Karma. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
एष वै परमो योगो मनसः संग्रहः स्मृतः ।
हृदयज्ञत्वमन्विच्छन् दम्यस्येवार्वतो मुहुः॥
An expert horseman, who wants to tame his stubborn horse, does so by allowing the horse have its way for a moment, and then, by gradually pulling the reigns, places the horse on the desired path. Similarly, the Supreme Yoga process is by which one observes the desires of the mind and gradually brings them under control. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 11.20.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावानव्ययो धर्मः पुण्यश्लोकैरुपासितः।
यो भूतशोकहर्षाभ्यामात्मा शोचति हृष्यति॥
When a person feels unhappy to see the distress of other living beings and is happy to see their happiness, such a person is regarded as imperishable by great ones, who are considered to be pious and loving. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 6.10.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावत्येव शुश्रूषा कार्या पितरि पुत्रकैः।
वाढमित्यनुमन्येत गौरवेण गुरोर्वचः॥
Children should obey the instructions of their father to its complete extent. One must obey the command of his father or spiritual master with due deference. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 3.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
एतदेव हि सच्छिष्यैः कर्तव्यं गुरुनिष्कृतम्।
यद्वै विशुद्धभावेन सर्वार्थात्मार्पणं गुरौ॥
The duty of all disciples is to repay their debt to the spiritual master by giving them wealth as well as surrender their life to them with a pure heart. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam,10.80.42)

title: Dainandini
description:
एकः प्रसूयते जन्तुरेक एव प्रलीयते।
एकोऽनुभुङ्क्ते सुकृतमेक एव च दुष्कृतम् ॥
Every creature in this world is born alone and dies alone. Alone, he experiences the fair reward for his good and bad deeds. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.49.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्यतस्य हि कामस्य प्रतिवादो न शस्यते।
अपि निर्मुक्तसङ्गस्य कामरक्तस्य किं पुनः॥
To deny an offering that has come your way by itself, is not commendable even for a person who is absolutely free from the attachements of sensual pleasures, much less than one who is addicted to sensual pleasures. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 3.22.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
ईश्वराणां वचः सत्यं तथैवाचरितं क्वचित्।
तेषां यत्स्ववचोयुक्तं बुद्धिमांस्तत्समाचरेत्॥
The statements of the Lord's empowered disciples are always true, and the acts they perform are exemplary when it is consistent with those statements. Therefore one who is intelligent should carry out their instructions. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.33.32)

title: Dainandini
description:
इन्द्रियाणि जयन्त्याशु निराहारा मनीषिणः।
वर्जयित्वा तु रसनं तन्निरन्नस्य वर्धते॥
If one artificially tries to give up the sense gratification, especially that of the tongue, the attempt will be a failure, and in fact one's desire for sense gratification will increase as a result of artificial deprivation. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 11.8.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
आयुः श्रियं यशोधर्मलोकानाशिष एव च।
हन्ति श्रेयांसि सर्वाणि पुंसो महदतिक्रमः॥
When a man abuses great souls, his blessings of longevity, beauty, fame, dharma and promotion to higher pursuits of life will be destroyed. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam, 10.4.46)

title: Dainandini
description:
असतः श्रीमदान्धस्य दारिद्र्यं परमञ्जनम्।
आत्मौपम्येन भूतानि दरिद्रः परमीक्षते॥
Atheists, who are very proud of their wealth, fail to see things as they are. Therefore, making them poor is the suitable ointment to their eyes, so they may see things as they are. At least, a man who is struck by poverty can realise how painful it is, therefore, will not want others to be in a painful condition like his own.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनागतमतीतं च वर्तमानमतीन्द्रियम्।
विप्रकृष्टं व्यवहितं सम्यक्पश्यन्ति योगिनः॥
Mystic Yogis have the ability to clearly perceive the past, present and the future. They have the capacity to look beyond the purview of the senses, even though remote or blocked by physical obstacles. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam X.61.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अण्वप्युपाहृतं भक्तैः प्रेम्णा भूर्येव मे भवेत्।
भूर्यप्यभक्तोपहृतं न मे तोषाय कल्पते॥
I am very pleased with the smallest gift offered to me with love by a devotee. On the contrary, I am not pleased even when a magnificent gift offered to me by a non- devotee. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam X.81.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुभ्यश्च महद्भ्यश्च शास्त्रेभ्यः कुशलो नरः।
सर्वतःसारमादद्यात्पुष्पेभ्य इव षट्पदः॥
Just as the honey bee takes in the nectar from all flowers, small and big, an intelligent man must take in the essence from all the religious scriptures. (Śrīmad Bhāgavatam XI.8.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवा ज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनाम यत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघं पुंसो दहेदेधो यथानलः॥
Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail.

description: Session IV -  Other Deities -   K.A. Lakshmana Sastri Endowment, Smt. Balambal Memorial Endowment and T.V. Nagaraja Iyer Endowment,  Dr. T.N. Aravamudan, Former Principal, Rajah's College, Thiruvaiyaru Chaired the session.

title: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil  - 24.11.2023 - Session III –  Śākta and others – 3:30 pm  to 5:00 pm
description: Session III -  Śākta and others  Subhadra Memorial Endowment and Bhagirati Ammal  Endowment,  Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of the KSRI Chaired the session.

 (Research Scholar, Presidency College, Chennai )

   (Research scholar, Sastra Deemed University, Tanjavur)

title: National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil  - 24.11.2023 - Session II –  Śaiva – 2:00 pm to 3:30 pm
description: Session II -  Śaiva under Sri Ramakrishna Iyer Memorial Endowment and Sri Anna Subrahmania Iyer Centenary  Endowment,  Dr. G. Suresh, Asst. Prof. of Sāhitya, The Madras Sanskrit College, Chaired the session.

title: Lectures on The Ramayana - Best gift for the Ramnavami
description:
Lectures on the Ramayana by Rt. Hon. V.S. Srinivasa Sastri, published by The Samskrita Academy, are reprinted in connection with the commemoration of Pranapratishtha of Sri Rama at Ayodhya. 
The copies will be available at the KSRI from the first week of February.  The cost of each copy is Rs. 300/-. The book in Tamil translation, Ramayanaperuraigal is also available. For copies, email: ksrimylapore@gmail.com
This will be the best gift for Ramnavami. please hurry! limited copies only!

title: Plight of KSRI during flood - 3 to 7 Dec. 2023
description: Due to recent rains, the institute was inundated with water for four days, and the water entered the ground floor of the institute, affecting hundreds of books and journals and a lot of furniture too. Such a calamity has never happened before in the history of the institute.
content:
Due to recent rains, the institute was inundated with water for four days, and the water entered the ground floor of the institute, affecting hundreds of books and journals and a lot of furniture too. Such a calamity has never happened before in the history of the institute. 

Under the expert supervision of the officials from archives and Connemara Library and Tanjore Saraswati Mahal Library, we are trying our level best to retrieve the books!slash!journals that were soaked in the water for four days. This is a very cumbersome process that requires not only great patience and expertise but also considerable money. The institute does not receive any grants from either the Central or the State governments and has been thriving on the contributions from some philanthropists and corporate sectors.

It is estimated that around Rupees One Crore would be required (Rs. 1,00, 00,000!slash!-) for mending the books, purchasing furniture including almirahs to keep books!slash!journals, electrical works, purchase of new Personal Computers, Laptops, Digital Camera (to record lectures) and so on.

        We earnestly appeal to your good self to kindly extend generous financial assistance to our Research Institute at this critical juncture which will help us in a long way in the preservation of ancient and rare books and manuscripts for posterity.

      Donations to our Research Institute are 100% exempt from Income Tax under section 35 (i) (iii) and 80GGA of the Income Tax Act. Cheques !slash! DDs may be in favour of “The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute”, For online remittance, our bank details are given below:

 

The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute,

Bank: Union Bank of India, Mylapore branch, 

SB a!slash!c no: 395702010007408 

IFSC : UBIN0539571


Donations requested only in Indian rupees from Indian citizens !slash! valid Indian passport holders.


Donors are requested to provide the following details to our email address: ksrinst@gmail.com

Name 

Address 

Mail id

Mobile no 

and PAN card details

title: National Seminar on "Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil" – 24th and 25th November 2023
description: As a Part of the 75th Anniversary, The KSRI conducted a "National Seminar on Bhakti Literature In Sanskrit and Tamil" on 24th and 25th of November 2023 in collaboration with The Samskrita Academy, Madras.  Dr. R. K. Raghavan, President of the KSRI delivered the Welcome address. Prof. C. R. Anantharaman, Former Prof.  of Sanskrit, Vivekananda College, Tiruvedagam, Madurai recieved the Kombur Ramabhadran Cash Award and  delivered the inaugural address on 24th November 2023 .

Dr. K. S. Balasubramanian, Director of the KSRI, Delivered a talk on "Sahaj Marg System of Raja Yoga" on August 29, 2023

Balasubramanian, Director of KSRI, delivered a lecture on "Panchabhuta - Vāyu"  and Dr. T. V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of KSRI, delivered a lecture on "Panchabhuta-Akasa".

title: Dr. T. V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of KSRI gave a lecture and chaired a session at the International Seminar on "Tantric Religion: Philosophy, Literature, Cults, Arts, History & Continuities" on 25t
description: The Department of History, School of Social Sciences & International Studies, Pondicherry University, Puducherry, organized an international seminar on "Tantric Religion: Philosophy, Literature, Cults, Arts, History, and Continuities" . Dr. T.V.V. Vasudeva, the Deputy Director of KSRI, chaired Session 5: Tantric, Cults, Traditions, and Practices and delivered a lecture on  'Tantric aspects in Vedic rituals'  on September 26, 2023. This event has been sponsored by the Shripuram Trust, Kerala, the Sri Aurobindo Centre for Advanced Research in Puducherry, and the Ministry of Culture.

title: Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Director of The KSRI was Invited as one of the VIP for the event " Unveiling the statue of Adi Shankaracharya" at Omkareshwar
description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan unveiled the 108-foot-tall ‘Statue of Oneness' of Adi Shankaracharya at Omkareshwar in the poll-bound on September 21. For this grand event, various institutions were invited from across India. Dr. K. Balasubramanin, Director of the KSRI, attended the same.

Yamuna Devi,  Deputy Director of The KSRI, Presided as the Chief guest and also delivered a talk on "Teacher student relationship and cultural values"

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्योगिनं पुरुषसिंहमुपैति लक्ष्मीः
दैवं हि दैन्यमिति कापुरुषाः वदन्ति।
दैवं निहत्य कुरु पौरुषमात्म शक्त्या
यत्ने कृते यदि न सिध्यति कोऽत्र दोषः॥
Wealth always reaches only those lion-like people who persistently keep trying and continuously toil. But some people consider poverty and misery as fate. One can overcome fate through continuous efforts. Even after trying hard, if one does not succeed, one should find out where the fault lies.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनागतमतीतं च वर्तमानमतीन्द्रियम्।
विप्रकृष्टं व्यवहितं सम्यक्पश्यन्ति योगिनः॥
Mystic Yogis have the ability to clearly perceive the past, present and the future. They have the capacity to look beyond the purview of the senses, even though remote or blocked by physical obstacles. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam X.61.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञः सुखमाराध्यः सुखतरमाराध्यते विशेषज्ञः।
ज्ञानलवदुर्विदग्धं ब्रह्माऽपि तं नरं न रञ्जयति॥
A person who is completely ignorant is easily guided, the wise is led more easily, but even the Supreme Being cannot influence the smatterer (Nītiśatakaṁ,mūrkhapaddhatiḥ-3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञः सुखमाराध्यः सुखतरमाराध्यते विशेषज्ञः।
ज्ञानलवदुर्विदग्धं ब्रह्माऽपि तं नरं न रञ्जयति॥
A person who is completely ignorant is easily guided, the wise is led more easily, but even the Supreme Being cannot influence the smatterer (Nītiśatakaṁ,mūrkhapaddhatiḥ-3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुभ्यश्च महद्भ्यश्च शास्त्रेभ्यः कुशलो नरः।
सर्वतःसारमादद्यात्पुष्पेभ्य इव षट्पदः॥
Just as the honey bee takes in the nectar from all flowers, small and big, an intelligent man must take in the essence from all the religious scriptures.

title: Dainandini
description:
नाधनो धर्मकृत्यानि यथावदनुतिष्ठति।
धनाद्धि धर्मो निस्रौति शैलाद्गिरिनदी यथा॥
The man who has no wealth cannot carry out religious acts, for these originate from wealth, like rivers from a mountain.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्थेनापि विहीनस्य पुरुषस्याल्पचेतसः।
विच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियास्सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा॥
All acts of a person, who endowed with little intelligence allows himself to be divested of wealth, are all dried up like shallow rivers in the summer.

title: Dainandini
description:
बोद्धारो मत्सरग्रस्ताः प्रभवः स्मयदूषिताः।
अबोधोपहताश्चान्ये जीर्णमङ्गे सुभाषितम्॥
The learned ones are jealous, kings are spoiled because of arrogance, the rest are ignorant, hence wise sayings perish in the body itself.

title: Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 12.07.2023 at the KSRI
description: Mr. K.N Srikkanth, Ph. D. candidate of Dr. K. S. Balasubramanian,  Director, The KSRI,  Defended his thesis on "CRITICAL STUDY  OF PĀṬIGAṆITA OF ŚRIDHARA AND GAṆITATILAKA OF ŚRIPATI"  at the Institute premises on 12th July 2023.

title: Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 08.06.2023 at the KSRI
description: Ms. S. Goda Devi, Ph. D. candidate of Dr. V. Kameswari,  Former Director, The KSRI, Defended her thesis on "KĀŚYAPA SAMHITĀ – TEXT ON VIṢACIKITSĀ : A CRITICAL STUDY "  at the Institute premises on 08th June 2023.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनाहूत: प्रविशति अपृष्टो बहु भाषते।
अविश्वस्ते विश्वसिति मूढचेता नराधम:॥
One who, enters unasked, speaks unsolicited words and has confidence in untrustworthy persons, is said to be the worst among fools.

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्या शौर्यं च दार्क्ष्यं च बलं धैर्यं च पञ्चमम्।
मित्राणि सहजान्याहुर्वर्तयन्ति हि तैर्बुधा:॥
Learning, valour, skill, strength and the fortitude are said to be natural friends. The wise base their mode of living on them.

title: Dainandini
description:

title: Dainandini
description:
माता गुरुतरा भूमे: खात् पितोच्चतरस्तथा।
मन: शीघ्रतरं वाताच्चिन्ता बहुतरी तृणात्॥
Mother is mightier than the earth; father is loftier than the sky; mind is faster than the wind but thought is lighter than a straw.

title: Dainandini
description:
जिह्वयातिप्रमाथिन्या जनो रसविमोहितः।
मृत्युमृच्छत्यसद्बुद्धिर्मीनस्तु बडिशैर्यथा॥
Just as a fish which is incited by the joy to enjoy his sense of taste, is fatally trapped in the fisherman's bait, similarly, a foolish person is attracted by the sense of taste of the material world and thus perishes. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
षड् दोषाःपुरुषेणेह हातव्या भूतिमिच्छता ।
निद्रा तन्द्री भयं क्रोधः आलस्यं दीर्घसूत्रता॥
One who aspires for prosperity should avoid the following six evils: excessive sleep, lassitude, fear, anger, indolence and procrastination.

title: Deputy Director of KSRI gave a lecture at the Two days National  Seminar on Manuscripts and Digitization  on 1st and 2nd July 2023.
description: Dr. T.V.V. Vasudeva, the Deputy Director of KSRI, delivered a Lecture on  'Granthalipi and utility of modern gadgets' in the two days National Seminar on Manuscripts and Digitization under the auspices of S V Manuscripts Project and Vedic University, Tirupati at the Sri Venkateswara Vedic University on 1st and 2nd July 2023. This event has been published in the local news paper, Tirupati.

title: Dainandini
description:
गुरुपत्नी राजपत्नी ज्येष्ठपत्नी तथैव च।
पत्नीमाता स्वमाता च पञ्चैता मातर: स्मृता:॥
Teacher's wife, King's wife, Elder brother's wife, Wife's mother and one's own mother – these five are to be considered as mothers.

title: Dainandini
description:
कालक्रमेण जगत: परिवर्तमाना।
चक्रारपङ्क्तिरिव गच्छति भाग्यपङ्क्ति:॥
The cycle of worldly fortune revolves like the set of spokes in a charriot wheel.

title: Dainandini
description:
कालक्रमेण जगत: परिवर्तमाना।
चक्रारपङ्क्तिरिव गच्छति भाग्यपङ्क्ति:॥
The cycle of worldly fortune revolves like the set of spokes in a charriot wheel.

title: Dainandini
description:
तुल्ये प्रियाप्रिये यस्य सुखदु:खे तथैव च।
अतीतानागते चोभे स वै सर्वधनी नर:॥
One who treats likes and dislikes, pleasure and pain; and past and future, with equanimity, possess all the wealth.

title: Dainandini
description:
सन्तोषामृततृप्तानां यत्सुखं शान्तचेतसाम्।
कुतस्तद्धनलुब्धानामितश्चेतश्च धावताम्॥
Happiness is in the possession of those who are contended and whose minds are in tranquility.Those who are in greed of wealth do not get the happiness, how much ever they try.

title: Dainandini
description:
सन्तोषामृततृप्तानां यत्सुखं शान्तचेतसाम्।
कुतस्तद्धनलुब्धानामितश्चेतश्च धावताम्॥
Happiness is in the possession of those who are contended and whose minds are in tranquility.Those who are in greed of wealth do not get the happiness, how much ever they try.

title: Dainandini
description:
न संशयं प्रपद्येत नाकस्मादप्रियं वदेत् ।
नाहितं नानृतं चैव न स्तेन: स्यान्न वार्धुषी॥
One should not be doubtful of everything; should not talk harshly for any reason; neither should one utter words which may cause harm to others or that are untrue; nor be a thief or an usurper.

title: Dainandini
description:
संसारविषवृक्षस्य द्वे एव रसवत्फले।
काव्यामृतरसास्वाद: सङ्गम: सुजनै: सह॥
Tasting the poetical nectar and the association with the good are the two sweetest fruits among the poisonous tree of worldly existence.

title: Dainandini
description:
वरं कूपशताद्वापी वरं वापीशतात्क्रतु:।
वरं क्रतुशतात्पुत्र: सत्यं पुत्रशताद्वरम्॥
A tank is superior to hundred wells; Performing a sacrifice is meritorious than digging hundred tanks; Begetting a son is more praiseworthy than hundred sacrifices. However, truth is commendable than hundred sons.

title: Dainandini
description:
आकल्यात् आनिशीथाश्च कुक्ष्यर्थं व्याप्रियामहे।
न च निर्वृणुमो जातु शान्तास्तु सुखमासते॥
Despite striving hard from dawn to dusk for the sake of belly, could not accomplish contentment unlike the ones steeped in tranquillity.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं माता पिता ज्ञानं धर्मो भ्राता दया सखा।
शान्ति: पत्नी क्षमा पुत्र: षडेते मम बान्धवा:॥
Truth is my mother, knowledge my father, Dharma my brother, compassion is friend, tranquility is wife, forbearance is son – these six qualities are considered the kinship of a virtuous man.

title: 75th Anniversary Inauguration celebrated on 24.05.2023
description: 75th Anniversary Celebrations of The KSRI was inaugurated  on 24.05.2023 at the The Madras Sanskrit College Premises, Mylapore. Sri T. S. Tirumurti (IFS Retd.) delivered the inaugural address and Dr. Sudha Seshayyan (Former Vice-Chancellor, Dr. MGR Medical University, Chennai) Gave the special address.
content: Click here for youtube video or paste url: https:!slash!!slash!youtu.be!slash!iYAoOv4YPQI

title: Dainandini
description:
उत्साहसम्पन्नमदीर्घसूत्रं क्रियाविधिज्ञं व्यसनेष्वसक्तम्।
शूरं कृतज्ञं दृढसौहृदं च लक्ष्मीस्वयं याति निवासहेतुः॥
Goddess Lakshmi resides in one – who is energetic, who does not procrastinate, who knows the theory and practice of a thing, who is not addicted to vices, who is brave, grateful and is firm in friendship.

title: Dainandini
description:
गुरुर्न स स्यात्स्वजनो न स स्यात् पिता न स स्याज्जननी न सा स्यात्।
दैवं न तत्स्यान्न पतिश्च स स्यात् नमो चयेद्यः समुपेत मृत्युम्॥
One who cannot help his devotees cross the repeated cycle of birth and death can neither become a Guru, a relative, a father, a mother, a demigod nor a husband.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.V.5.18)

title: Dainandini
description:
अल्पानामपि वस्तूनां संहति: कार्यसाधिका ।
तृणैर्गुणस्वमापन्नैर्बध्यन्ते मत्तदन्तिन:॥
The union of even small things leads to the accomplishment of an object; infuriated elephants are tied down by means of grass twisted into a rope.

title: Dainandini
description:
शकटं पञ्चहस्तेषु दशहस्तेषु वाजिनम् ।
गजं हस्तसहस्रेषु दुर्जनं दूरतस्त्यजेत्॥
This subhāṣita cautions a person to keep a distance of 5 hasta (cubits) from a vehicle, ten cubits from a horse and 1000 cubits from an elephant but to keep as much away as possible from an evil person.

title: Dainandini
description:
दमेन सदृशं धर्मं नान्यं लोकेषु शुश्रुम।
दमो हि परमो लोके प्रशस्तः सर्वधर्मिणाम्॥
There is no other duty in all the worlds equal to self-control. Self-control, according to all virtuous persons, is the highest virtue in this world.

title: Dainandini
description:
आपत्सु मित्रं जानीयात् युद्धे शूरमृणे शुचिम्।
भार्यां क्षीणेषु वित्तेषु व्यसनेषु च बान्धवम्॥
One can know a true friend during the time of crisis; a person's bravery in the battle field; honesty in the manner he returns his loan; a spouse in the way she behaves during financial crisis; and the true nature of relatives at the time of calamity.

title: Dainandini
description:
कौमारमाचरेत्प्राज्ञो धर्मान्भागवतानिह।
दुर्लभं मानुषं जन्म तदप्यध्रुवमर्थदम् ॥
One must utilise the human birth from the very beginning of his childhood in activities of devotional service, giving up other desires. A human birth is very rare to achieve, and although the human birth is also temporary, it gives us an opportunity to practice devotion. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VII.6.1)

title: Dainandini
description:
लोहयुक्तं यथा हेम विपक्वं न विराजते।
तथापक्वकषायाख्यं विज्ञानं न प्रकाशते॥
As gold, when united with iron, loses its purity and cannot shine, so knowledge when existing with attachment to earthly objects fails to display its splendour.

title: Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Deputy Director of The KSRI Spoke on "The Philosophy and Sankhya and Yoga"
Dainandini
description:
किं विद्यया किं तपसा किं त्यागेन श्रुतेन वा।
किं विविक्तेन मौनेन स्त्रीभि र्यस्य मनोहृतम्॥
What is the use of education, penance, renunciation, studying of scriptures, or living in solitude in silence, if one's mind is stolen by a woman? (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.26.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
निर्मुक्तभवनक्षेत्राः स्युः सदागतिनिर्वृताः।
प्राप्ते भयविपर्यासे भोगिनःखलु भोगिनः॥
Having relinquished (their) abode, land, contented by the visits of supplicants, great men, in fact are at ease due to the absence of fear of poverty. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
शोको नाशयते धैर्यं शोको नाशयते श्रुतम् ।
शोको नाशयते सर्वं नास्ति शोकसमो रिपु : ॥
Grief destroys patience, understanding and everything. Hence there is no enemy equal to grief.

title: Dainandini
description:
आकृष्यन्ते करिणः पङ्कनिमग्ना महद्विपैरेव।
प्राप्तापदो महान्त उद्धरणीया महापुम्भिः॥
Mighty elephants only can save those of their counterparts caught in the mud ; like men of great reputation, if, caught into difficulties can only be rescued by other great men.

title: Dainandini
description:
आगमिष्यन्ति ते भावा ये भावा मयि भाविनः।
अहं तैरनुसर्तव्यो न तेषामन्यतो गतिः॥
Whatever destiny written for me would reach me certainly. I shall be followed by it; its course cannot be altered in a different way.

title: Dainandini
description:
संभ्रम: स्नेहमाख्याति वपुराख्याति भोजनम्।
आचार: कुलमाख्याति देशमाख्याति भाषणम्॥
Agitation bespeaks affection, physique diet, behavior lineage and speech country.

title: Dainandini
description:
कालो बलीयान्बलिनां भगवानीश्वरोऽव्ययः।
प्रजाः कालयते क्रीडन्पशुपालो यथा पशून्॥
Inexhaustible time, which is stronger than the strong, is the Supreme Personality of God. Like a herdsman who moves his animals along, he moves mortal creatures as his Divine play. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.51.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
आपो वस्त्रं तिला तैलं गन्धो वास यथा तथा।
पुष्पाणामधिवासेन तथा संसर्गजा गुणा:॥
Water, cloth, sesame seeds or oil take the fragrance of the flowers they come into contact with. It is contact that leads to emergence of qualities.

title: Dainandini
description:
अप्यनावर्जिताः स्वेन फलरागेण सन्नताः।
अर्भकैरपि गृह्यन्ते साधुसन्तानशाखिनः॥
Great men, like the lofty celestial trees, bow down due to weights of their merits (fruits) enable even children to reap the benefits. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
अद्भिर्गात्राणि शुध्यन्ति मन: सत्येन शुध्यति ।
विद्यातपोभ्यां भूतात्मा बुद्धिर्ज्ञानेन शुध्यति॥
Body is cleansed with water; mind purified with truth; soul with study and the intellect is purified with knowledge.

title: Dainandini
description:
अभिमुख्यदशामात्रादादर्श इव सज्जनः।
शीघ्रं रक्तमरक्तं वा गृह्णाति स्वप्रसादतः॥
The noble person, like the mirror reflecting the objects in its front, accepts or adopts at once the one seeking favour or the other, by his magnanimity. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.1)

title: Dainandini
description:
कर्मणा जायते जन्तुः कर्मणैव निलीयते।
सुखं दुःखं भयं क्षेमं कर्मणैवाभिपद्यते॥
It is by the Law of Karma that a living being takes birth, and it is by Karma alone, that a living being meets his destruction. His happiness, sorrow, fear, and sense of security arise as the effects of Karma. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्प: क्रूर: खल: क्रूर: सर्पात् क्रूरतर: खल: ।
मन्त्रौषधिवश: सर्प: खल: केन निवार्यते॥
A serpent as well as wicked man are cruel; wicked is more cruel than the serpent. While a serpent can be subdued by mantras and herbs, there is no control for the wicked.

title: Dainandini
description:
नीतिःसती त्वयि परं परपुष्टधातुः
पुत्रीकृतोऽपि बलिपुष्टकुलैर्यतस्त्वम्।
दूरीकृतोऽपि पुरुषैस्तत एव काले
कण्ठो यदेष तव पञ्चममुञ्चकार॥
The favour of creator holds good for you, Oh Cuckoo though nurtured by others and driven out by them at the appropriate time, you have been blessed with this melodious voice. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.11)

title: Dainandini
description:
विधौ लब्धधृतिर्नीत्या विनतानन्दनो द्विजः।
नियम्यमानैःस्थानेषु भुजगैरपि भूष्यते॥
A person established in statecraft, adept in carrying out acts, modest, is revered even by rogues appointed in respective positions. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
ऋणशेषोऽग्निशेषश्च व्याधिशेषस्तथैव च ।
पुनश्च वर्धते यस्मात् तस्माच्छेषं न कारयेत्॥
Remains of a debt, fire and disease would grow again and hence these should completely be wiped out.

title: Dainandini
description:
कामाधिकरणग्राह्यकुलादिबलशालिनः।
अहीनेऽपि नरेन्द्रस्य शक्तयः सिद्धिहेतवः॥
The three fold strength of the Monarch who had acquired the fame of victorious predecessors ( his ancestors) are the source of victory even during the battle with a powerful King. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
एष वै परमो योगो मनसः संग्रहः स्मृतः।
हृदयज्ञत्वमन्विच्छन्दम्यस्येवार्वतो मुहुः॥
An expert horseman, who wants to tame his stubborn horse, does so by allowing the horse have its way for a moment, and then, by gradually pulling the reigns, places the horse on the desired path. Similarly, the Supreme Yoga process is by which one observes the desires of the mind and gradually brings them under control. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.20.21)

title: Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Deputy Director of The KSRI Spoke on "The Philosophy and Sankhya and Yoga"
description: ICPR , Dept. of Sanskrit, Loyola College and Dept. of Sanskrit, Ethiraj College for Woment, Chennai  Jointly organised a A Series of Periodical Lectures on Indian Philosophy from 3rd February 2023 to 29th March 2023.  Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Deputy Director of The KSRI, gave a talk on " The Philosophy of Sankhya and Yoga" .

title: Dainandini
description:
न कश्चित्कस्यचित्मित्रं न कश्चित् कस्यचिद्रिपु:।
व्यवहारेण जायन्ते मित्राणि रिपवस्तथा॥
Nobody is anybody's friend or foe. It is only the conduct that makes friends or foes.

title: Dainandini
description:
स्वदृष्टिप्रतिघातेऽपि स्वच्छे क्वचन शोभनः।
तत्र ह्यभिमुखः स्वात्मा झटित्येव प्रकाशते॥
The impaired vision of one in some instances becomes beneficial, for, the radiance of self at once reflects in his presence ( instantly). (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.4)

title: Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 10.03.2023 at the KSRI
description: Ms. N. Bhuvaneswari, Ph. D. candidate of Dr. V. Kameswari, Directer, The KSRI, Defended her thesis on CRITICAL STUDY OF THE PLAY PRASANNARĀGHAVA OF JAYADEVA at the Institute premises on 10th March 2023.

title: Dainandini
description:
अमृतस्यन्दिनं कश्चित्कृष्णमेघं द्विजः स्मरन्।
उदन्यया न वेशन्तमुदन्वन्तं च वीक्षते॥
Contemplating on the dense cloud that pours nectarine water, a certain bird (cātaka) does not look at either the pond or the Ocean.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
भयेन भेदयेद्भीरुं शूरमञ्जलिकर्मणा।
लुब्धमर्थप्रदानेन समं न्यूनं तथौजसा॥
One should win over a coward by scaring him, a brave by humility, a greedy with money and the equals or inferior by showing valor.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावानव्ययो धर्मः पुण्यश्लोकैरुपासितः।
यो भूतशोकहर्षाभ्यामात्मा शोचति हृष्यति॥
When a person feels unhappy to see the distress of other living beings and is happy to see their happiness, such a person is regarded as imperishable by great ones, who are considered to be pious and loving. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.10.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
अहार्येण कदाप्यन्यैरसंहार्येण केनचित्।
तितिक्षाकवचेनैव सर्वं जयति संवृतः॥
A person covering himself with the armour of endurance which cannot be carried away by others, accomplishes everything. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
अनभ्यासे विषं विद्या अजीर्णे भोजनं विषम्।
विषं सभा दरिद्रस्य वृद्धस्य तरुणी विषम्॥
Knowledge, without constant study, is poisonous; Intake of food during indigestion turns into poison; an assembly is a poison for poor and for an old man a young woman is poison.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावत्येव शुश्रूषा कार्या पितरि पुत्रकैः।
वाढमित्यनुमन्येत गौरवेण गुरोर्वचः॥
Children should obey the instructions of their father to its complete extent. One must obey the command of his father or spiritual master with due deference. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
ब्रह्महत्यादिपापानां कथञ्चिन्निष्कृतिर्भवेत्।
विश्वासघातिनां पापं न नश्येज्जन्मकोटिभि:॥
There can be atonement for the sins like the killing of a brahmin, etc. The sin of betrayal of trust cannot be destroyed even by millions of births.

title: Sanjeev Sanyal, Member, Economic Advisory Council, Government of India,  Visited The KSRI on 17.02.2023
Viva Voce Examination was conducted on 02.02.2023 at the KSRI
description: Ms. S. Madhurambika, The First Ph. D. candidate of Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, KSRI, Defended her thesis on ŚĀHENDRAVILĀSA OF ŚRĪDHARA VEṄKAṬEŚA: A CRITICAL STUDY  at the Institute premises on 2nd Feb. 2023.

title: Hon'ble Vice Chancellor, Central Sanskrit University , New Delhi, Visited The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute on 8th January 2023
description: Prof. Shrinivasa Varkedi, Vice Chancellor, Central Sanskrit University , New Delhi, Visited The Institute and the library.  A Power Point Presentation of our Institute and its activities were presented to him. He also had a glance of our books published as well as a few rare M.Phil and Ph.D. Dissertations.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं वेदेषु जागर्ति फलं सत्ये परं स्मृतम्।
सत्याद् धर्मो दमश्चैव सर्वं सत्ये प्रतिष्ठितम्॥
Truth is awake in the Vedas. The fruit attached to truth has been described as the highest. From truth originate righteousness and self-control. Everything is established in truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्वत्वं वा नृपत्वं वा नैव तुल्यं कदाचन।
स्वदेशे पूज्यते राजा विद्वान् सर्वत्र पूज्यते॥
Being a scholar and a king are never at par. The king gets respect in his own country while a scholar gets it everywhere.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं ब्रह्म तपः सत्यं सत्यं विसृजते प्रजाः।
सत्येन धार्यते लोकः स्वर्गं सत्येन गच्छति॥
Truth is Brahma; truth is penance, it is truth which creates all creatures. The world is governed by truth and one goes to heavens by (adhering to) truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतदेव हि सच्छिष्यैः कर्तव्यं गुरुनिष्कृतम्।
यद्वै विशुद्धभावेन सर्वार्थात्मार्पणं गुरौ॥
The duty of all disciples is to repay their debt to the spiritual master by giving them wealth as well as surrender their life to them with a pure heart. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.80.42)

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्यायोपार्जितं वित्तं दशवर्षाणि तिष्ठति ।
प्राप्ते चैकादशे वर्षे समूलञ्च विनश्यति ॥
The wealth, earned through dishonest and unfair means may last for a short period of ten years. Later the ill-gotten money will vanish in totality.

title: Dainandini
description:
एकः प्रसूयते जन्तुरेक एव प्रलीयते।
एकोऽनुभुङ्क्ते सुकृतमेक एव च दुष्कृतम्॥
Every creature in this world is born alone and dies alone. Alone, he experiences the fair reward for his good and bad deeds.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.49.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
पार्थिवानां पदार्थानां स्वभूत्या चक्रवर्तिनाम्।
जनयत्यचिराद्भेदं छिद्रेण महतान्वयः॥
The riches or the prosperity of the Monarchs and their family- by their abundance, generate soon rifts ( due to quarrels among them). (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्यतस्य हि कामस्य प्रतिवादो न शस्यते।
अपि निर्मुक्तसङ्गस्य कामरक्तस्य किं पुनः॥
To deny an offering that has come your way by itself, is not commendable even for a person who is absolutely free from the attachements of sensual pleasures, much less than one who is addicted to sensual pleasures.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.22.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
अनङ्गीकृतकामानामनुमानार्हवर्ष्मणाम्।
धृतनिर्मलतीर्थानां भूतिलेपो विभूषणम्॥
Wealth which is seen with persons who practice detachment, their unblemished knowledge in Sastras, happiness, their undiminished spirit of showing devotion to Lord all these are considered to be the ornaments for them.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.VI.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्या ददाति विनयं विनायद्याति पात्रताम्।
पात्रत्वाद्धनमाप्नोति धनाद्धर्मं तत: सुखम्॥
Learning endows one with modesty; from modesty arises worthiness; being worthy brings in riches; riches begets religious merits which ultimately leads to happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
महान्तं पुरुषं प्राप्य कंचित्सत्वप्रवर्तकम्।
प्रतिबुद्धो जनस्तेन परमं साम्यमश्नुते॥
A Person, having approached a noble one who imparts virtues, becomes enlightened by him and identical with him. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
ईश्वराणां वचःसत्यं तथैवाचरितं क्वचित्।
तेषां यत्स्ववचोयुक्तं बुद्धिमांस्तत्समाचरेत्॥
The statements of the Lord's empowered disciples are always true, and the acts they perform are exemplary when it is consistent with those statements. Therefore one who is intelligent should carry out their instructions. (Sr.Bh.X.33.32)

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा खनन् खनित्रेण नरो वार्यधिगच्छति।
तथा गुरुगतां विद्यां शुश्रूषुरधिगच्छति॥
Just as a person who digs with a spade gets water, a student with his obedience obtains knowledge from his teacher.

title: Dainandini
description:
इन्द्रियाणि जयन्त्याशु निराहारा मनीषिणः।
वर्जयित्वा तु रसनं तन्निरन्नस्य वर्धते॥
If one artificially tries to give up sense gratification, especially that of the tongue, the attempt will be a failure, and in fact one's desire for sense gratification will increase as a result of artificial deprivation. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचाराल्लभते श्रियम्।
आचारात् कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च॥
Longevity can be accomplished through good conduct and so does the wealth; Similarly fame is attained by a person here and hereafter too.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रायेण श्रीमतां लोके भोक्तुं शक्तिर्न विद्यते।
काष्ठान्यपि हि जीर्यन्ते दरिद्राणां च सर्वश:॥
It is very common in this world that rich men have no appetite while the poor can digest even pieces of wood.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयुः श्रियं यशो धर्म लोकानाशिष एव च।
हन्ति श्रेयांसि सर्वाणि पुंसो महदतिक्रमः॥
When a man abuses great souls, his blessings of longevity, beauty, fame, dharma and promotion to higher pursuits of life will be destroyed. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.4.46)

title: Dainandini
description:
सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं दुःखस्यानन्तरं सुखम्।
न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम्॥
Sorrow comes after happiness and happiness after sorrow. One does not always suffer sorrow or always enjoy happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
दानशीलो भवेद्राजा यज्ञशीलश्च भारत।
उपवासतपश्शीलः प्रजानां पालने रतः॥
Intent on protecting the subjects (people), the king should adhere to austerities of observing fasts.

title: Dainandini
description:
अहो दैन्यमहो कष्टं पारक्यैः क्षणभंगुरैः।
यन्नोपकुर्यादस्वार्थैर्मर्त्यः स्वज्ञातिविग्रहैः॥
The body which is actually consumed by jackals and dogs after my death, does no good for me. It is perishable, and can be used only for a short time. The body, it's possessions, it's riches and relatives should be used for the benefit of uplifting others. Else, they will be sources of tribulations and misery. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam VI.10.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
नाभिषेको न संस्कार: सिंहस्य क्रियते मृगै:।
विक्रमार्जितराज्यस्य स्वयमेव मृगेन्द्रता॥
The animals do not perform any coronation or ritual for the lion to be a king but he earns the Lordship over the jungle-kingdom through his bravery.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनार्यमार्यवृत्तेन सत्येनानृतवादितम्।
रिपुमप्युपकारेण वशीकुर्वन्ति साधव:॥
Good people win over the bad souls by their good conduct; untruthful with truth and even the enemies by favouring them.

title: Dainandini
description:
नाधनो धर्मकृत्यानि यथावदनुतिष्ठति।
धनाद्धि धर्मो निस्रौति शैलाद्गिरिनदी यथा॥
The man who has no wealth cannot carry out religious acts, for these originate from wealth, like rivers from a mountain.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्थेनापि विहीनस्य पुरुषस्याल्पचेतसः।
विच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियास्सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा॥
All acts of a person, who endowed with little intelligence allows himself to be divested of wealth, are all dried up like shallow rivers in the summer.

title: Dainandini
description:
वीतरागा विमुच्यन्ते पुरुषाः कर्मबन्धनैः।
कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ये न हिंसन्ति किंचन॥
They who never injure others in thoughts, word or deed, and who never attach themselves to anything, can never be fettered by deeds.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनुव्रतानां शिष्याणां पुत्राणां च द्विजोत्तम |
अनापृष्टमपिब्रूयुर्गुरवो दीनवत्सलाः॥
O Blessed one! Spiritual masters are very kind to the needy people, to their disciples, and to their sons, and impart all that is known to them, without being asked. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam III.7.36)

title: Dainandini
description:
अनागतमतीतं च वर्तमानमतीन्द्रियम्।
विप्रकृष्टं व्यवहितं सम्यक्पश्यन्ति योगिनः॥
Mystic Yogis have the ability to clearly perceive the past, present and the future. They have the capacity to look beyond the purview of the senses, even though remote or blocked by physical obstacles. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam X.61.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुः पूर्वं बृहद्वै हि भवत्यार्येषु संगतम्।
विपरीतमनार्येषु यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु॥
One should think before choosing his friend. As friendship of the good is small at first but grows immensely; but the opposite is the case with the wicked.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यधर्मरताः सन्तः सर्वलिङ्गविवर्जिताः।
धर्मलब्धार्थभोक्तारस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः॥
Those persons who are devoted to the religion of truth, who are righteous and destitute of the indications of the several modes of life, and who enjoy the wealth acquired by fair means , succeeds in ascending to Heaven.

title: Dainandini
description:
अण्वप्युपाहृतं भक्तैः प्रेम्णा भूर्येव मे भवेत्।
भूर्यप्यभक्तोपहृतं न मे तोषाय कल्पते॥
I am very pleased with the smallest gift offered to me with love by a devotee. On the contrary, I am not pleased even when a magnificent gift offered to me by a non- devotee. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.81.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अकाले कृत्यामारब्धं कर्तुं नार्थाय कल्पते।
तदेव काल आरब्धं महतेऽर्थाय कल्पते ॥
An act started in the improper time never becomes profitable. The same act when started in the proper time always yields great rewards.

अतिकुपिता अपि सुजना योगेन मृदूभवन्ति न तु नीचाः।
हेम्नः कठिनस्यापि द्रवणोपायोऽस्ति न तृणानाम्॥
A good man's exceeding anger can be calmed by some means, but not so of a mean person. Though hard, gold can be melted but not grass.

title: Dainandini
description:
रूपयौवनसंपन्ना: विशालकुलसंभवा:।
विद्याहीना: न शोभन्ते निर्गन्धा: इव किंशुका:॥
Those who are uneducated do not shine even if they are endowed with beauty and youth and are born in renowned families just like kimśuka flowers which are beautiful but odourless.

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्नं प्राणा नराणां हि सर्वमन्ने प्रतिष्ठितम्।
अन्नदः पशुमान् पुत्री धनवान् भोगवानपि॥
Food forms the life breath of men. Everything rests upon food. He who makes gift of food gets many animals, many children, profuse riches and all articles of comfort and luxury in profusion.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयु: कर्म च वित्तञ्च विद्या निधनमेव च।
पञ्चैते ननु कल्प्यन्ते गर्भगत्वेन देहिनाम्॥
Longevity, deeds, prosperity, knowledge and death of a person are decided even while he is in the mother's womb.

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवा ज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनाम यत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघं पुंसो दहेदेधो यथानलः॥
Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.2.18)

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्नेन सदृशं दानं न भूतं न भविष्यति।
तस्मादन्नं विशेषेण दातुमिच्छन्ति मानवाः॥
There has never been, nor will be, any gift equal to the gift of food. Hence, men always wish particularly to make gifts of food.

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्प: क्रूर: खल: क्रूर: सर्पात्क्रूरतर: खल:।
मन्त्रोषधवश: सर्प: किमुदुष्टो भयङ्कर:॥
The snake and the wicked person are both dangerous. The poison of a snake can be neutralized by mantra or medicine while there is no mantra or medicine that can remove the poison of a wicked person.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिक्रान्तं तु यः कार्यं पश्चाच्चिन्तयते नरः।
तच्चास्य न भवेत् कार्यं चिन्तया तु विनश्यति॥
The man who broods over past matters not only loses their results but also is destroyed by worry.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिक्रान्तं तु यः कार्यं पश्चाच्चिन्तयते नरः।
तच्चास्य न भवेत् कार्यं चिन्तया तु विनश्यति॥
The man who broods over past matters not only loses their results but also is destroyed by worry.

title: Deputy Directors of KSRI Chaired the Research Scholars Sessions at the  International Seminar on "Sriman Narayaneeyam"
description:
The Madras Sanskrit College & S.S. V. Patasala, Chennai,   Sri V. Krishnaswami Iyer Sanskrit Education Trust and Veera Subbaiya Swamigal Mutt Trust Jointly organised  a Two day International Seminar on "Sriman Narayaneeyam" on 8th  and 9th of  January 2023.   
Dr. K.S. Balasubramanian, Deputy Director of the KSRI , Chaired the afternoon session on 08.01.2023 and , Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of The KSRI Chaired the  forenoon session on 09.01.2023.

title: Assitant Professors of KSRI presented papers in International Conference on Srimannarayaneeyam
description: From 08th to 09th of January 2023, Scholars of KSRI participated and presented Research articles at the Two days International  Seminar on "Sriman- Narayaneeyam" organised by The Madras Sanskrit College & S.S.V. Patasala, Chennai jointly with Central Sanskrit University, New Delhi.

title: Assitant Professors of KSRI presented papers in National Conference
description: From 09th to 10th of December 2022 Scholars of KSRI has been participated and presented Research articles at the two days International  Seminar on Science and Technology in Sanskrit Texts organised by Assam University along with Samskrita Bharati, Silchar.
content: <ol><li>Dr.V.Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor, KSRI, presented a paper on "<em>Extraction and Application of Natural Dyes as Recorded in Sanskrit Literature".<!slash!em><!slash!li><li>Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Assistant Professor, KSRI presented the paper on "<em>Kunapajala - An Ancient Indian Technique for Nourishing The Flora".<!slash!em><!slash!li><li>Dr. V. Preethi, Assistant Professor, KSRI, presented a paper on "<em>Rainbows - Ancient Indian vis - a - vis Modern Scientific Views".<!slash!em><!slash!li><li>Ms. Lavanya V. Eswar, Ph.D. Research Scholar, KSRI, presented a paper on "<em>Ragas and The Mind".<!slash!em><!slash!li><!slash!ol>

title: Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Deputy Director of The KSRI Spoke on "Vacaspati Misra - His Life and Works"
description: ICPR and Darbhanga Sanskrit University Jointly organised a National Seminar on Vacaspati Misra - His Life and Works from 19th to 21st of  December 2022. Dr. K. S Balasubramainan, Deputy Director of The KSRI, gave a talk on " Contribution of Vacaspati Misra to yoga" (Online).

title: Assistant Professor of KSRI was invited to Judge a competition at the Madras Sanskrit College, Chennai
description: Dr.V. Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor of The KSRI, Chennai, was  a judge for the competition "75 years of Indian Independence and contribution of Sanskrit Scholars" organised by The Madras Sanskrit College on 14th of October 2022.

title: Dainandini
description:
शकटं पञ्चहस्तेषु दशहस्तेषु वाजिनम् ।
गजं हस्तसहस्रेषु दुर्जनं दूरतस्त्यजेत्॥
This subhāṣita cautions a person to keep a distance of 5 hasta (cubits) from a vehicle, ten cubits from a horse and 1000 cubits from an elephant but to keep as much away as possible from an evil person.

title: Deputy Director of KSRI gave a talk at the valedictory session of the 3 days Residential Workshop on 24th December 2022
description:
Dr. T.V.V. Vasudeva, the Deputy Director of KSRI, delivered a speech on  'My Experience 
 in Translation' in a valedictory session of a "Anuvadhasaurabham" Three days Residential Workshop on Effective Translation in Indian Languages organised by Chinmaya Vihwa Vidyalaya (Deemed to be University) In Association with Bharatiya Bhasha Samiti, held from 22nd to 24th December 2022.

title: Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of The KSRI, spoke about Sri Swaminatha Atreya at The Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, Chennai
description: The disciples of  Sri Swaminatha Atreya organised a "Samsmaranotsava" in his memory on 30th November, 2022 at Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, Mylapore, Chennai. Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of KSRI, spoke about Sri Swaminatha Atreya.

title: Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of KSRI Chaired a Session and also gave a talk at an International conference on Surya
description: French Institute of Indology and Rastriya Samskrit Sansthan Jointly organised a International Conference on Surya on 4th November 2022. Dr. T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of The KSRI, Chaired the last session of the Conference and gave a talk on "Surya in Rg. Veda"

title: Deputy Director of KSRI was invited to Judge a competition at the Madras Sanskrit College, Chennai
description: Dr. T.V.V. Vasudeva, the Deputy Director of The KSRI, Chennai, was  a judge for the competition "Free distribution in the elections manifesto is right or wrong" organised by The Madras Sanskrit College on 13th of October 2022.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिलौल्यप्रसक्तानां विपत्तिर्नैव दूरतः।
जीवं नश्यति लोभेन मीनस्यामिषदर्शने॥
For those who are exceptionally greedy, danger is not far off just as the fish loses its life by its greed for the piece of flesh.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठा भूतानां प्रज्ञा लाभः परो मतः।
प्रज्ञा निःश्रेयसो लोके प्रज्ञा स्वर्गो मतस्सताम्॥
Knowledge is the basis for beings; knowledge is considered the greatest acquisition; knowledge is the greatest happpiness in the world; knowledge is considered by the good as heaven.

title: Dainandini
description:
नास्ति भूमिसमं दानं नास्ति भूमिसमो गुरुः।
नास्ति सत्यसमो धर्मो नास्ति दानसमो निधिः॥
There is no gift equal to a gift of the earth. There is none worthy of greater respect than the mother. There is no duty higher than truth. There are no riches more valuable than that which are given away.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिजीवति वित्तेन सुखं जीवति विद्यया।
किंचिज्जीवति शिल्पेन ऋते कर्म न जीवति॥
One lives in superabundance when one has wealth; one lives happily by learning; one lives in a normal manner by skills; but one does not live at all when there is no work to do.

title: Dainandini
description:
सुलभा युधि विप्रर्षे ह्यनिवृत्तास्तनुत्यजः ।
न तथा तीर्थ आयाते श्रद्धया ये धनत्यजः ॥
Many men have given up their lives in the battlefield, never afraid to fight. But, rarely has one utilised the chance to give his accumulated wealth to a saintly person who creates sacred places. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VIII.20.9)

title: New Year Dairy - Ramayana Diary
description:
Ramayana Diary is a unique publication of the Samskrita Academy, Chennai.
New Year Gift for All
content:
The Ramayana Diary has only the month and the date and not the day and the year with select shlokas from the Ramayana for each day. Hence it can be utilised for all years. The Ramayana Diary can be a special gift for your near and dear ones for the upcoming years to come.

Price @ Rs. 150 only.

To get the copies mail to: ksrinst@gmail.com

Phone: 044 29505320

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुरप्यसतां सङ्गः सद्गुणं हन्ति विस्तृतम्।
गुणरूपान्तरं याति तक्रयोगाद्यथा पयः॥
A large quantity of milk undergoes a transformation by its getting mixed up with a little buttermilk. Hence, a little association with the wicked destroys good qualities in abundance.

title: Dainandini
description:
दृष्टिपूतं न्यसेत्पादं वस्त्रपूतं पिबेज्जलम्।
सत्यपूतां वदेद्वाचं मनः पूतं समाचरेत्॥
A saintly person should set his foot on the ground only after keenly observing whether his feet would harm any insect or other living creatures which might be injured by his foot. He must drink water only after filtering it through a portion of his cloth. He must only speak those words which is filled by purity of truth. Similarly, he must perform activities only after ascertaining it to be pure. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.XI.18.16)

title: Dainandini
description:
दुर्लभो मानुषो देहो देहिनां क्षणभङ्गुरः।
तत्रापि दुर्लभं मन्ये वैकुण्ठप्रियदर्शनम् ॥
For any conditioned soul, being manifest in a human body is most difficult to achieve, and it can be lost at any moment. But, I think, even those who have achieved a human birth rarely gain the association of pure devotees who are dear to the Lord of Vaikuṇṭha. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.XI.2.29)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानं खलु कष्टम् क्रोधादिभ्योऽपि सर्वपापेभ्यः।
अर्थं हितमहितं वा न वेत्ति येनावृतो लोकः॥
Ignorance is a great evil, greater than all the vices like anger and so on; a man confined in it does not know a good object from a bad.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनङ्गीकृतकामानामनुमानार्हवर्ष्मणाम्।
धृतनिर्मलतीर्थानां भूतिलेपो विभूषणम्॥
Wealth which is seenwith persons who practice detachment, their unblemished knowledge in Sastras, happiness, their undiminished spirit of showing devotion to Lord all these are considered to be the ornaments for them. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.6.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
तावत्प्रमोदते स्वर्गे यावत्पुण्यं समाप्यते।
क्षीणपुण्यः पतत्यर्वागनिच्छन्कालचालितः॥
Until the fruits of his goodness are used up, the performer of the sacrifice enjoys the heavenly abode. When the fruits of his good deeds are exhausted, he falls down from the pleasure gardens of heaven, henceforth acting against his desire by the force of eternal time. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.XI.10.26)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञं कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति तज्ञ्ज्ञं कर्म न लिम्पति।
लिप्यते रसनैवैका सर्पिषा करवद्यथा॥
All the works hang heavily only on the ignorant person but not so on proficient one. Ghee sticks to the palm but not to the tongue.

title: Dainandini
description:
तांस्तान्कामान्हरिर्दद्यात् यान्यान्कामयते जनः।
आराधितो यथैवैष तथा पुंसां फलोदयः॥
When a devotee performs his duties following the karma – kriyä activities, God completely takes care of him and is responsible for the fulfilment of his desires. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.IV.13.44)

title: Dainandini
description:
अकारणं रूपमकारणं कुलं महत्सु नीचेषु च कर्म शोभते।
इदं हि रूपं परिभूतपूर्वकं तदेव भूयो बहुमानमागतम् ॥
It is neither the personality nor the family; among the high or low the good deed alone shines. This personality which was hated at first, has now gained the great honour.

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्वार्थसंभयो देहो जनितः पोषितो यतः ।
न तयोर्याति निर्वेशं पित्रोर्मर्त्यः शतायुषा ॥
With one's body one can acquire all pursuits of life, and it is one's parents who give the body birth and sustenance. Therefore no mortal man can repay his debt to his parents, even if he serves them for a full lifetime of a hundred years. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.45.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
उत्साह सम्पन्नमदीर्घसूत्रं
क्रिया विधिज्ञं व्यसनेष्वसक्तम्।
शूरं कृतज्ञं दृढसौहृदं च
लक्ष्मीः स्वयं याति निवास हेतोः॥
Goddess Lakṣmī or wealth is attracted to one who is endowed with enthusiasm; who does not procrastinate, who plans his actions and executes them as per the plan, who is not overwhelmed with offerings, who is valourous, never forgets the timely help rendered by others and who has loyal friends.

title: Dainandini
description:
संनिकर्षोऽत्र मर्त्यानामनादरणकारणम् ।
गाङ्गं हित्वा यथान्याम्भस्तत्रत्यो याति शुद्धये ॥
In this world familiarity breeds contempt. For example, one who lives on the banks of the Ganges might travel to some other water body to be purified. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.84.31)

title: Dainandini
description:
भूमौ जायन्ति पुरुषा भूमौ निष्ठां व्रजन्ति च।
चतुर्विधो हि लोकोऽयं योऽयं भूमिगुणात्मकः॥
Living creatures originate from earth and it is to the earth that they return when they disappear. Living creatures which are divided into four classes have earth for their primordial essence.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिक्रान्तं तु यः कार्यं पश्चाच्चिन्तयते नरः।
तच्चास्य न भवेत् कार्यं चिन्तया तु विनश्यति॥
The man who broods over past matters not only loses their results but also is destroyed by worry.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिक्रान्तं तु यः कार्यं पश्चाच्चिन्तयते नरः।
तच्चास्य न भवेत् कार्यं चिन्तया तु विनश्यति॥
The man who broods over past matters not only loses their results but also is destroyed by worry.

title: Dainandini
description:
लब्धा सुदुर्लभमिदं बहुसंभवान्ते
मानुष्यमर्थदमनित्यमपीह धीरः ।
तूर्णं यतेत न पतेदनुमृत्यु यावत्
निःश्रेयसाय विषयः खलु सर्वतः स्यात् ॥
After many, many births and deaths one achieves the rare human form of life, which, although temporary, facilitates one to attain the Supreme Lord. Thus a clear – headed human being should quickly strive for the ultimate perfection of life as long as his body, which is always subject to death, has not fallen down and died.
