After all, sense gratification is available even in the most abominable species of life, whereas Kṛṣṇa consciousness is possible only for a human being. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.9.29)

title: Dainandini
description:
इदमेव हि निर्णीतं पैशुन्याद्दुःखसङ्गमः।
अन्यार्थं खनतो गर्तं कूपे पातः सुनिश्चितः॥
It is a well settled principle that a person, if indulged, in the tale bearing, experiences grief will surely sooner or later fall himself into a pit dug with the intent of making others fall.

title: Dainandini
description:
अतिकुपिता अपि सुजना योगेन मृदूभवन्ति न तु नीचाः।
हेम्नः कठिनस्यापि द्रवणोपायोऽस्ति न तृणानाम्॥
A good man's exceeding anger can be calmed by some means, but not so of a mean person. Though hard, gold can be melted but not grass.

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा चन्द्रमसो वृद्धिरहन्यहनि जायते।
तथा भूमिकृतं दानं सस्ये सस्ये विवर्धते॥
As the moon increases day by day, so the merit of a gift of earth increases every time the earth produces crops. (Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.62.33)

title: Dainandini
description:
राज्ञो हि परमो धर्मः स्वधर्मस्थानुपालनम् ।
शासतोऽन्यान् यथाशास्त्रमनापद्युत्पथानिह ॥
The foremost duty of a King is to give all protection to law-abiding persons and to reprimand those who stray from the ordinances of the scriptures in ordinary times, when there is no emergency. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.I.17.16)

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुरप्यसतां सङ्गः सद्गुणं हन्ति विस्तृतम्।
गुणरूपान्तरं याति तक्रयोगाद्यथा पयः॥
A large quantity of milk undergoes a transformation of getting mixed up with a little buttermilk. Hence, a little association with the wicked destroys good qualities in abundance.

title: Dainandini
description:
शमो दमस्तथा धैर्यं सत्यं शौचमथार्जवम्।
यज्ञो धृतिश्च धर्मश्च नित्यमार्षो विधिः स्मृतः॥
Tranquility, self-restraint, fortitude, truth, purity, simplicity, sacrifices, perseverance and righteousness – these are always the virtues recommended by the Rishis. (Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.XII.17)

title: Dainandini
description:
धर्मार्थकाममोक्षाख्यं य इच्छेच्छ्रेय आत्मनः।
एकमेव हरेस्तत्र कारणं पादसेवनम्॥
He who strives for the four paths of human pursuit – righteousness, economic development, gratification of senses, and self-realisation, should engage himself in the devotional service of the Supreme One, for worship of His Lotus feet will give rise to fulfilment in all these paths. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IV.8.41)

title: Dainandini
description:
तथारिभिर्न व्यथते शिलीमुखैः
शेतेऽर्दिताङ्गो हृदयेन दूयता।
स्वानां यथा वक्रधियां दुरुक्तिभिः
दिवानिशं तप्यति मर्मताडितः॥
If one gets hurt by the arrows of an enemy, he is not as pained as when he is hurt by the sharp words of a relative, for such pain continues to taunt one's heart day and night. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IV.3.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्जितं स्वेन वीर्येण नान्यपाश्रित्य कंचन।
फलशाकमपि श्रेयो भोक्तुं ह्यकृपणं गृहे॥
One (should not touch) the things those are not earned by his own valour or not depending on others; it is better to eat even fruits or vegetables in his own house unhindered by dejection.

title: Dainandini
description:
तावज्जितेन्द्रियो न स्याद्विजितान्येन्द्रिय: पुमान् ।
न जयेद्रसनं यावज्जितं सर्वं जिते रसे ॥
If the tongue is not conquered although all the other senses have been conquered, it cannot be said that one has conquered all senses. However, if one is able to control the tongue, he is said to be in full control of all his senses. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.XI.8.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अग्नौ प्राप्तं प्रधूयेत यथा तूलं द्विजोत्तम।
तथा गङ्गावगाढस्य सर्वं पापं प्रधूयते॥
Just as cotton when it comes into contact with fire, is burnt off without any trace, likewise the sins of men are washed off without any trace when he bathes in the river Ganges.

title: Dainandini
description:
मातरं पितरं वृद्धं भार्या साध्वी सुतं शिशुम् ।
गुरुं विप्रं प्रपन्नं च कल्पोऽबिभ्रच्छृसन्मृतः ॥
If an able man does not take care of his elderly parents, pure wife, young child, or spiritual teacher, a Brahmin or anyone who seeks his protection, is considered dead, even though he is breathing. (śrīmadbhāgavataṁ. X. 45.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
भ्रातरीशकृतः पाशो नृणां यः स्नेहसंज्ञितः ।
तं दुस्त्यजमहं मन्ये शूराणामपि योगिनाम् ॥
Sri Vasudeva Said, “O Brother, God himself has made the knot called affection, by which human beings are bonded together. It seems to me that even great heroes and mystics find it difficult to free themselves from it” (śrīmadbhāgavataṁ. X. 74.61)

title: Dainandini
description:
इदमेव हि निर्णीतं पैशुन्याद्दुःखसङ्गमः।
अन्यार्थं खनतो गर्तं कूपे पातः सुनिश्चितः॥
It is a well settled principle that a person, if indulged, in the tale bearing, experiences grief will surely sooner or later fall himself into a pit dug with the intent of making others fall.

title: Dainandini
description:
व्यालं बालमृणालतन्तुभिरसौ रोद्धुं समुज्जृम्भते
छेत्तुं वज्रमणिं शिरीषकुसुमप्रान्तेन सन्नह्यति।
माधुर्यं मधुबिन्दुना रचयितुं क्षाराम्बुधेरीहते
नेतुं वाञ्छति यः खलान्पथि सतां सूक्तैः सुधास्यन्दिभिः॥
He who leads the wicked into the path of virtue through the nectar-like sayings of the nobles, is as one who tries to, bind an elephant with a soft lotus-fibre, cut the diamond with a filament of çirīṣa flower, make the salt sea sweet with a drop of honey. (Nītiśataka.I.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
इदमन्धं तमः कृत्स्नं जायेत भुवनत्रयम्।
यदि शब्दाह्वयं ज्योतिः आसंसारान् न दीप्यते॥
The whole of three worlds were to plunge into thick darkness, if the light called, ‘ word' does not illuminate them.

title: Dainandini
description:
लभेत सिकतासु तैलमपि यत्नतः पीडयन्
पिबेच्च मृगतृष्णिकासु सलिलं पिपासार्दितः।
कदाचिदपि पर्यटञ्छशविषाणमासादयेन्न
तु प्रतिनिविष्टमूर्खजनचित्तमाराधयेत्॥
A man may get oil from sand by trying out hardly, drink water from a mirage when oppressed by thirst, obtain possession of the horn of a hare but cannot win over the mind of a fool. (Nītiśataka.I.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचाराल्लभते श्रियम्।
आचारात् कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च॥
Longevity can be accomplished through good conduct and so does the wealth; Similarly fame is attained by a person here and hereafter too.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रसह्य मणिमुद्धरेन्मकरवक्त्रदंष्ट्रान्तरात्
समुद्रमपि सन्तरेत् प्रचलदूर्मिमालाकुलम्।
भुजङ्गमपि कोपितं शिरसि पुष्पवद् धारयेन्न
तु प्रतिनिविष्टमूर्खजनचित्तमाराधयेत्॥
A person may forcibly get back a jewel from the teeth of a crocodile, cross over the ferocious waves of the sea, wear an angry serpent on his head like a garland of flowers, but can't win over the mind of one who is foolish and stubborn.(Nītiśataka.I.4)

title: Dainandini
description:
ब्राह्मणः समदृक् शान्तो दीनानां समुपेक्षकः ।
स्रवते ब्रह्म तस्यापि भिन्नभाण्डात्पयो यथा ॥
Although a Brāḥmin is peaceful and unbiased as he treats everyone equally, it is not his duty to neglect needy humans. By such neglect, His spiritual power diminishes just like the water kept in a cracked pot leaks out. (śrīmadbhāgavataṁ. IV. 14.141)

title: Dainandini
description:
इत्थं सभापतिर्भूत्वा यः काव्यानि परीक्षते।
यशस्तस्य जगद्व्यापि स सुखी तत्र तत्र च॥
Thus ( who) being a presiding judge of a gathering comprising of learned people, is indulged in the examination of merits and demerits of poetic compositions, by and large his fame spreads everywhere and will be happy wherever he goes.

title: Dainandini
description:
इतो हास्यतरं लोके किञ्चिदन्यन्न विद्यते।
यत्तु दुर्जन इत्याह सज्जनं दुर्जनः स्वयम्॥
There cannot be more laughable thing in this world ( unfortunately), that people who are themselves wicked call the wise ones bad.

title: Dainandini
description:
आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचाराल्लभते श्रियम्।
आचारात् कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च॥
Longevity can be accomplished through good conduct and so does the wealth; Similarly fame is attained by a person here and hereafter too.

title: Dainandini
description:
बोद्धारो मत्सरग्रस्ताः प्रभवः स्मयदूषिताः।
अबोधोपहताश्चान्ये जीर्णमङ्गे सुभाषितम्॥
The learned ones are jealous, kings are spoiled because of arrogance, the rest are ignorant, hence wise sayings perish in the body itself. (Nītiśataka.I.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
आकृष्यन्ते करिणः पङ्कनिमग्ना महद्विपैरेव।
प्राप्तापदो महान्त उद्धरणीया महापुम्भिः॥
Mighty elephants only can save those of their counterparts caught in the mud ; like men of great reputation, if, caught into difficulties can only be rescued by other great men.

title: SAMMĀRJANĪ ŚATAKAM  OF ĀSŪRI ĀNANDĀḺVĀR : A CRITICAL STUDY - M.Phil., Dissertation Submitted to the University of Madras
description: Mrs. R. Gayathri, M.Phil. student  of KSRI,  submitted her M.Phil., dissertation under the guidance of Dr. V. Yamuna Devi on "SAMMĀRJANĪ ŚATAKAM  OF ĀSŪRI ĀNANDĀḺVĀR : A CRITICAL STUDY" to the University of Madras on 30.09.2022

title: Sarasvati Puja Celebration on 3rd October 2022
description: The  Staff and Students of KSRI celebrated Sarasvati Puja on Monday 3rd October 2022 at 3 pm at the Institute premises

title: Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Assistant Professor of KSRI delivered an Endowment lecture under the Samskrita Academy, Chennai
description: On the Occasion of Mahakavi Kalidasa Day, an online lecture was organized on 6th October 2022 under Sri. Venkatnarayana Iyer and Smt. Sundarambal Endowment. Dr. P.C. Muralidharan delivered a lecture on "Message of Kalidasa" which was followed by the musical rendering of verses from Kalidasa's works by Dr. Jayadevi Prakash from KSRI.

title: Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Assistant Professor of KSRI delivered a guest lecture at M.O.P. Vaishnav College for Women
description: "SARASVATHA SAMITI", Department of Sanskrit of The M.O.P Vaishnav College for Women organized a guest lecture on 6th October, 2022 and invited  Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Assistant Professor of KSRI. He delivered a lecture on the Introduction to Vedas.

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा प्रयान्ति संयान्ति स्रोतोवेगेन वालुकाः ।
संयुज्यन्ते वियुज्यन्ते तथा कालेन देहिनः ॥
As small particles of sand are brought together or separated by the force of waves, the manifest beings sometimes come together or are separated by the waves of time.(Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.VI.15.3)

title: Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor of KSRI invited as a Chief guest at M.O.P. Vaishnav College for Women
description: The Sanskrit Department of M.O.P Vaishnav College had organized the Sanskrit Day Celebration on 25th August 2022. Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor of  KSRI,  was invited as a chief guest of the day. She delivered a guest lecture and judged the various  events  conducted as a part of the celebration.

title: Dainandini
description:
आगमिष्यन्ति ते भावा ये भावा मयि भाविनः।
अहं तैरनुसर्तव्यो न तेषामन्यतो गतिः॥
Whatever destiny written for me would reach me certainly. I shall be followed by it; its course cannot be altered in a different way.

title: Dainandini
description:
तप्यन्ते लोकतापेन साधवः प्रायशो जनाः।
परमाराधनं तद्धि पुरुषस्याखिलात्मनः॥
It is said that great people accept suffering voluntarily, due to the extreme suffering of the world at large. This is considered as the highest method of worshipping the Supreme One who dwells in each one of our hearts. (Śrīmadbhāgavataṁ.VIII.7.44)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानं खलु कष्टम् क्रोधादिभ्योऽपि सर्वपापेभ्यः।
अर्थं हितमहितं वा न वेत्ति येनावृतो लोकः॥
Ignorance is a great evil, greater than all the vices like anger and so on; a man confined in it does not know a good object from a bad.

title: Dainandini
description:
योऽनित्येन शरीरेण सतां गेयं यशो ध्रुवम् ।
ना चिनोति स्वयं कल्पः स वाच्यः शोच्य एव सः ॥
He is considered to be pitied, who, though blessed with a human body, fails to achieve that everlasting bliss which is glorified by the great saints. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.72.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च द्वयं देहे प्रतिष्ठितम्।
मृत्युमापद्यते मोहात् सत्येनापद्यतेऽमृतम्॥
Immortality and Death, both exist in the body. One meets with death through delusion; while immortality is gained by truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
यावद्धियेत जठरं तावत्स्वत्वं हि देहिनाम् ।
अधिकं योऽभिमन्येत सस्तेनो दण्डमर्हति ॥
One may require ownership of the amount of wealth that is required to maintain the body and the soul together. But, if a person is greedy of more wealth than what that is required, is considered to be a thief and is deserved to be punished by the laws of nature. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VII.14.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
न बिभेति यदा चायं यदा चास्मान्न बिभ्यति।
यदा नेच्छति न द्वेष्टि ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा॥
When a person himself feels no fear and is feared by no one, when he has no desire and no hatred, he is then said to attain the state of Brahman.

title: Dainandini
description:
या दुस्त्यजा दुर्मतिभिर्जीयतो या न जीर्यते ।
तां तृष्णां दुःखनिवहां शर्मकामो द्रुतं त्यजेत् ॥
For those who are too attached to sense gratification, it is very difficult to give it up. Even when one is incapacitated because of old age, one cannot give up such desires for material enjoyment. Therefore, one who actually desires true happiness must give up such unsatisfied desires, which are the cause of all trouble. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IX.19.16)

title: Dainandini
description:
शिरः शार्वं स्वर्गात् पशुपतिशिरस्तः क्षितिधरं
महीध्रादुत्तुङ्गादवनेश्चापि जलधिम्।
अधोऽधो गङ्गेयं पदमुपगता स्तोकमथवा
विवेकभ्रष्टानां भवति विनिपातः शतमुखः॥
The Ganges falls from heaven upon the head of çiva, from the head of çiva on to the mountains, from the top of the mountain to the earth, thus falling lower and lower. Thus, in so many ways is the fall of one whose judgement has departed from him. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
शिरः शार्वं स्वर्गात् पशुपतिशिरस्तः क्षितिधरं
महीध्रादुत्तुङ्गादवनेश्चापि जलधिम्।
अधोऽधो गङ्गेयं पदमुपगता स्तोकमथवा
विवेकभ्रष्टानां भवति विनिपातः शतमुखः॥
The Ganges falls from heaven upon the head of çiva, from the head of çiva on to the mountains, from the top of the mountain to the earth, thus falling lower and lower. Thus, in so many ways is the fall of one whose judgement has departed from him. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
बुद्धिमन्तं कृतप्रज्ञं शुश्रूषुमनुसूयकम्।
दान्तं जितेन्द्रियं चापि शोको न स्पृशते नरम्॥
Sorrow can never touch an intelligent man, who has acquired wisdom, who obeys the instructions of his elders, who has no envy and has controlled his self. (Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.174.41)

title: Dainandini
description:
यश्च मूढतमो लोके यश्च बुद्धेः परंगतः ।
तावुभौ सुखमेधेते क्लिश्यत्यन्तरितो जनः ॥
Both the lowest of fools and the one who has transcended all materialism enjoy happiness, whereas persons between them suffer the material pangs.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.7.17)

title: Dainandini
description:
कृमिकुलचितं लालाक्लिन्नं विगन्धि जुगुप्सितं
निरुपमरसं प्रीत्या खादन्नरास्थि निरामिषम्।
सुरपतिमपि श्वा पार्श्वस्थं विलोक्य न शङ्कते
न हि गणयति क्षुद्रो जन्तुः परिग्रहफल्गुताम्॥
A dog eats with delight rotten odious bones and though the king of Gods may stand before him takes no heed. Just like that, a mean person considers not the worthlessness of that which belongs to him. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
कृमिकुलचितं लालाक्लिन्नं विगन्धि जुगुप्सितं
निरुपमरसं प्रीत्या खादन्नरास्थि निरामिषम्।
सुरपतिमपि श्वा पार्श्वस्थं विलोक्य न शङ्कते
न हि गणयति क्षुद्रो जन्तुः परिग्रहफल्गुताम्॥
A dog eats with delight rotten odious bones and though the king of Gods may stand before him takes no heed. Just like that, a mean person considers not the worthlessness of that which belongs to him. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
यशो यशस्विनां शुद्धं श्लाघ्या ये गुणिनां गुणाः ।
लोभः स्वल्पोऽपि तान् हन्तिश्चित्रो रूपमिवेप्सितम् ॥
Whatever fame is possessed by people of acclaim, whatever praiseworthy qualities are possessed by the virtuous, is destroyed even by the smallest amount of greed, just like a handsome person is ruined by a trace of white leprosy.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.23.16)

title: Dainandini
description:
ययोरात्मसमं वित्तं जन्मैश्वर्याकृतिर्भवः ।
तयोर्विवाहो मैत्री च नोत्तमाधमयोः क्वचित् ॥ 
Wedlock and friendship is always favourable when two people are equal in the terms of wealth, birth, influence, beauty and capacity for good progeny, but never favourable for two people who are superior and inferior. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.60.15)

title: Dainandini
description:
यदा किञ्चिज्ज्ञोऽहं द्विप इव मदान्धः समभवं
तदा सर्वज्ञोऽस्मीत्यभवदवलिप्तं मम मनः।
यदा किञ्चित्किञ्चिद् बुधजनसकाशादवगतं
तदा मूर्खोऽस्मीति ज्वर इव मदो मे व्यपगतः॥
When I knew a little, I was blinded by pride, as an elephant by passion. My mind was exalted, and, in my ignorance, I thought I knew all things. Then I came into the presence of the wise, my pride left me like a fever. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
धर्मे वर्धति वर्धन्ति सर्वभूतानि सर्वदा।
तस्मिन् ह्रसति ह्रीयन्ते तस्माद् धर्मं न लोपयेत्॥
All creatures prosper ever by the growth of righteousness and deteriorate with its decay. Righteousness therefore should never be left to decay.

title: Dainandini
description:
नान्यत्र बुद्धिक्षान्तिभ्यां नान्यत्रेन्द्रियनिग्रहात्।
नान्यत्र धनसंत्यागाद् गणः प्राज्ञेऽवतिष्ठते॥
The collection of qualities of intelligence and forgiveness, control of the senses and liberality, reside in a person of wisdom. (Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.81.26)

title: Dainandini
description:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेयान् इतरस्तत्तदीहते ।
स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते ॥
The society follows the actions of their leader and imitate him. They accept whatever their leader accepts as proof of evidence and truth. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.2.4)

title: Dainandini
description:
स्वायत्तमेकान्तगुणं विधात्रा
विनिर्मितं छादनमज्ञतायाः।
विशेषतः सर्वविदां समाजे
विभूषणं मौनमपण्डितानाम्॥
The Lord of creation has given man, the gift of silence, the special ornament of the ignorant in the assembly of the wise, which is readily available and is like a cloak to conceal his ignorance. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
राजा चरति चेद् धर्मं देवत्वायैव कल्पते।
स चेदधर्मं चरति नरकायैव गच्छति॥
If a king acts righteously, he is considered god. If, however, he acts unrighteously, he sinks into hell.

title: Dainandini
description:
व्यालं बालमृणालतन्तुभिरसौ रोद्धुं समुज्जृम्भते
छेत्तुं वज्रमणिं शिरीषकुसुमप्रान्तेन सन्नह्यति।
माधुर्यं मधुबिन्दुना रचयितुं क्षाराम्बुधेरीहते
नेतुं वाञ्छति यः खलान्पथि सतां सूक्तैः सुधास्यन्दिभिः॥
He who leads the wicked into the path of virtue through the nectar-like sayings of the nobles, is as one who tries to, bind an elephant with a soft lotus-fibre, cut the diamond with a filament of śirīṣa flower, make the salt sea sweet with a drop of honey. (Nītiśatakaṁ.I.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
यदा न कुरुते भावं सर्वभूतेष्वमङ्गलम् ।
समदृष्टेस्तदा पुंसः सर्वाः सुखमया दिशः ॥
When man does not envy anyone and does not have ill will towards anyone is equipoised. The path for such a man is always favourable. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IX.19.15)

title: Dainandini
description:
लभेत सिकतासु तैलमपि यत्नतः पीडयन्
पिबेच्च मृगतृष्णिकासु सलिलं पिपासार्दितः।
कदाचिदपि पर्यटञ्छशविषाणमासादयेन्न-
तु प्रतिनिविष्टमूर्खजनचित्तमाराधयेत्॥
A man may get oil from sand by trying out hardly, drink water from a mirage when oppressed by thirst, obtain possession of the horn of a hare but can't win over the mind of a fool. (Nītiśatakaṁ- mūrkhapaddhatiḥ-5)

title: Dainandini
description:
कृतज्ञं प्राज्ञमक्षुद्रं दृढभक्तिं जितेन्द्रियम्।
धर्मनित्यं स्थितं नीत्यं मन्त्रिणं पूजयेन्नृपः॥
The king should duly honor the minister who is grateful, wise, large-hearted, loyal, a master of his senses, virtuous and observant of the dictates of policy.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रसह्य मणिमुद्धरेन्मकरवक्त्रदंष्ट्रान्तरात्
समुद्रमपि सन्तरेत् प्रचलदूर्मिमालाकुलम्।
भुजङ्गमपि कोपितं शिरसि पुष्पवद् धारयेन्न-
तु प्रतिनिविष्टमूर्खजनचित्तमाराधयेत्॥
A person may forcibly get back a jewel from the teeth of a crocodile, cross over the ferocious waves of the sea, wear an angry serpent on his head like a garland of flowers, but can't win over the mind of one who is foolish and stubborn. (Nītiśatakaṁ- mūrkhapaddhatiḥ-4)

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा प्रयान्ति संयान्ति स्रोतोवेगेन वालुकाः ।
संयुज्यन्ते वियुज्यन्ते तथा कालेन देहिनः ॥
As small particles of sand are brought together or separated by the force of waves, the manifest beings sometimes come together or are separated by the waves of time. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.15.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
य उद्यतमनादृत्य कीनाशमभियाचते ।
क्षीयते तद्यशः स्फीतं मानश्रावज्ञया हतः ॥
One who rejects an opportunity come out of it's own accord but later begs a boon from a miser, loses his honour, and his pride is humbled by the neglect of others. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.22.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञः सुखमाराध्यः सुखतरमाराध्यते विशेषज्ञः।
ज्ञानलवदुर्विदग्धं ब्रह्माऽपि तं नरं न रञ्जयति॥
A person who is completely ignorant is easily guided, the wise is led more easily, but even the Supreme Being cannot influence the smatterer. (Nītiśatakaṁ- mūrkhapaddhatiḥ-3)

title: Dainandini
description:
मातरं पितरं वृद्धं भार्या साध्वी सुतं शिशुम् ।
गुरुं विप्रं प्रपन्नं च कल्पोऽबिभ्रच्छृसन्मृतः ॥
If an able man does not take care of his elderly parents, pure wife, young child, or spiritual teacher, a Brahmin or anyone who seeks his protection, is considered dead, even though he is breathing. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.45.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
वज्रादपि कठोराणि मृदूनि कुसुमादपि।
लोकोत्तराणां चेतांसि को नु विज्ञातुमर्हति॥
It is difficult to fathom the hearts of the lofty people which at times is harder than the diamonds and at times softer than a flower.

title: Dainandini
description:
नैकत्र प्रियसंवासः सुहृदां चित्रकर्मणाम्।
ओघेन व्यूह्यमानानां प्लवानां स्रोतसो यथा॥
Many planks and sticks, unable to stay together, gets carried away by the current of the river. Although, we are connected intimately with our family and friends, we are unable to stay together because of our past karma (deeds) and the waves of time. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.5.25)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञं कर्माणि लिम्पन्ति तज्ञ्ज्ञं कर्म न लिम्पति।
लिप्यते रसनैवैका सर्पिषा करवद् यथा॥
All the works hang heavily only on the ignorant person but not so on proficient one. Ghee sticks to the palm but not to the tongue.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्जितं स्वेन वीर्येण नान्यपाश्रित्य कंचन।
फलशाकमपि श्रेयो भोक्तुं ह्यकृपणं गृहे॥
One (should not touch) the things those are not earned by his own valour or not depending on others; it is better to eat even fruits or vegetables in his own house unhindered by dejection.

title: Dainandini
description:
ननु स्वार्थपरो लोको न वेद परसंकटम्।
यदि वेद न याचेत नेति नाह यदीश्वरः॥
Those who are selfish beg something from others, unaware of other's pain. But if the beggar knew the difficulty of the giver, he would not ask for anything. Similarly, the one who is able to give charity, is unaware of the difficulties of the beggar, otherwise he would not refuse to give the beggar anything as charity. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.10.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं प्रियं वा यदि वाप्रियम्।
प्राप्तं प्राप्तमुपासीत हृदयेनापराजितः॥
Be it happpiness or be it misery, be it pleasant or be it otherwise, what comes to one should be enjoyed or put up with an unconquered heart.

title: Dainandini
description:
न सभां प्रविशेत्प्राज्ञः सभ्यदोषाननुस्मरन्।
अब्रुवन्विब्रुवन्नज्ञो नरः किल्बिषमश्नुते॥
A wise man should not enter an assembly when he knows that the participants there are involved in sinful activity. If he still happens to go there, he must speak only the truth, and if he fails to do so, speaks falsely or pleads ignorance, will surely incur sin. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.44.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्यैव चापि धनिनां द्रविणात्मिका श्री:|
विद्यात्मिका च विदुषामपरैव लक्ष्मी:॥
Fortune of the rich in the form of wealth is different from the wealth of knowledge of the learned.

title: Dainandini
description:
अजानता भवेत्कश्चिद् अपराधः कुतो यदि।
क्षन्तव्यमेव तस्याहुः सुपरीक्ष्य परीक्षया॥
People who have analysed the problem well, declare that one has to forgive a person who has insulted without knowledge.

title: Dainandini
description:
न तथा तप्यते विद्धः पुमान्बाणैः सुमर्मगैः।
यथा तुदन्ति मर्मस्था ह्यसतां परुषेषवः ॥
Sharp arrows which pierce the chest and reaches one's heart do not have as much effect of suffering as the harsh and insulting words that reaches one's heart. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.23.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अजरामरवत् प्राज्ञो विद्यामर्थं च चिन्तयेत्।
गृहीत इव केशेषु मृत्युना धर्ममाचरेत्॥
A wise man should fix his thoughts upon knowledge and wealth as if he were immortal and eternal and he should practise his duties as if he were seized by the hairs of his head by death.

title: Dainandini
description:
न बुद्धिर्धनलाभाय न जाड्यमसमृद्धये।
लोकपर्यायवृत्तानां प्राज्ञो जानाति नेतरः॥
Intelligence cannot give wealth, nor is stupidity the cause of poverty. Only, a wise man and none else, understands the order of the world.

title: Dainandini
description:
धर्मं समाचरेत् पूर्वं ततोऽर्थं धर्मसंयुतम्।
ततः कामं चरेत् पश्चात् सिद्धार्थः स हि तत्परम्॥
One should first adhere to Virtue; then amass wealth in righteous way, then seek the gratification of Desire; having accomplished these he should strive for the fourth one – emancipation.

title: Dainandini
description:
अघटितघटितं घटयति सुघटितघटितानि जर्जरीकुरुते।
विधिरेव तानि घटयति यानि पुमान्नैव चिन्तयति॥
Destiny associates the non-associated, non-associates associated; – it links the things that no man thinks of.

title: Dainandini
description:
न जातु कामःकामानामुपभोगेन शाम्यति।
हविषा कृष्णवर्त्मेन भूय एवाभिवर्धते ॥
Offering ghee to a fire, does not diminish it, but instead it ignites it more. The same way, one can never be successful while striving to fulfil desires by sense gratification. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IX.19.14)

title: Dainandini
description:
कोकिलानां स्वरो रूपं लज्जा रूपं कुलस्त्रिय:।
विद्याया: पटुता रूपं रूपं मूर्खस्य मौनता॥
Beauty of the cuckoo is it's sound, that of a noble woman is her modesty, skill is the beauty of knowledge and silence of a foolish person.

title: Dainandini
description:
अग्नौ प्राप्तं प्रधूयेत यथा तूलं द्विजोत्तम।
तथा गङ्गावगाढस्य सर्वं पापं प्रधूयते॥
Just as cotton when it comes into contact with fire, is burnt off without any trace, likewise the sins of men are washed off without any trace when he bathes in the river Ganges.

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवा ज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनाम यत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघं पुंसो दहेदेधो यथानलः॥
Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.2.18)

title: Dainandini
description:
अभिवादन शीलस्य नित्यं वृद्धोपसेविनः।
चत्वारि तस्य वर्धन्ते आयुर्विद्या यशो बलम् ॥
For the one who offers respect and renders service to the elders, these four prosper in him – life span, knowledge, fame and health.

title: Dainandini
description:
धर्मव्यतिक्रमो दृष्ट ईश्वराणां च साहसम्।
तेजीयसां न दोषाय वन्हेः सर्वभुजो यथा॥
Great persons are not affected by apparent transgression of morality, for they are like fire, which devours all that is fed into it, but it's nature stays the same. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.33.29)

title: Dainandini
description:
काककोकिलभृङ्गानां बकव्यालशिखण्डिनाम्।
हंसकुक्कुटलोहानां शिक्षेत चरितं नृप:॥
A king should learn the ways of the world from the crow, cuckoo, bee, crane, serpent, peacock, swan, cock and red goat.

title: Dainandini
description:
नास्ति सत्यात् परो धर्मो नानृतात् पातकं परम्।
स्थितिर्हि सत्यं धर्मस्य तस्मात् सत्यं न लोपयेत्॥
There is no duty which is higher than truth and no sin more dreadful than untruth. Indeed, truth is the very root of righteousness. Therefore, one should never lack truth.

title: Dainandini
description:
अकस्मात् प्रक्रिया नॄणाम् अकस्माच्चापकर्षणम्।
शुभाशुभे महत्वं च प्रकर्तुं बुद्धिलाघवात् ॥
The success of men as also their fall happens by itself. Auspicious (good) and inauspicious (bad) and greatness all proceed from weakness of understanding.

title: Dainandini
description:
अकस्मात् प्रक्रिया नॄणाम् अकस्माच्चापकर्षणम्।
शुभाशुभे महत्वं च प्रकर्तुं बुद्धिलाघवात् ॥
The success of men as also their fall happens by itself. Auspicious (good) and inauspicious (bad) and greatness all proceed from weakness of understanding.

title: Dainandini
description:
तांस्तान्कामान्हरिर्दद्यात यान्यान्कामयते जनः।
आराधितो यथैवैष तथा पुंसां फलोदयः॥
When a devotee performs his duties following the karma –(kriya) activities, God completely takes care of him and is responsible for the fulfilment of his desires. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IV.13.34)

title: Dainandini
description:
दमो नान्यस्पृहा नित्यं गाम्भीर्यं धैर्यमेव च।
अभयं रोगशमनं ज्ञानेनैतदवाप्यते॥
Self-control consists in never wishing for another man's property always, in gravity and patience and power to remove the fear of others regarding one's own self and freedom from disease – these are acquired through knowledge.

title: Dainandini
description:
अपुनर्देहिशब्दार्थमप्रत्युपकृतिक्षमम्।
अर्थिनं कुरुते कश्चित्पुनरावृत्तिवर्जितम्॥
A generous man makes his supplicant so wealthy that he will never ever have to seek again and that he will never come back to him for any favour. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
द्वावेव चिन्तया मुक्तौ परमानन्द आप्लुतौ।
यो विमुग्धो जडो बालो यो गुणेभ्यः परं गतः॥
In this world there are two types of people who are free from all anxiety and immersed in great happiness: one who is a childish fool and one who has approached the Supreme Lord. He is beyond the three modes of materialism. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.9.4)

title: Dainandini
description:
अकर्मशीलं च महाशनं च लोकाद्विष्टं बहुमायं नृशंसम्।
अदेशकालज्ञमनिष्टवेषम् एतान् गृहे न प्रतिवासयीत॥
One who is lazy, eats much, who is hauled by the people, who is crafty and cruel, who does not know time and place and who dresses in an undesirable way – such persons are not to be lodged in one's home.

title: Dainandini
description:
अश्व: शस्त्रं शास्त्रं वीणा वाणी नरश्च नारी च।
पुरषविशेषं प्राप्ता भवन्त्ययोग्याश्च योग्याश्च॥
Horse, weapon, scripture, lyre, speech, man or a woman becomes worthy or unworthy depending on the person who possesses them.

title: Dainandini
description:
अश्व: शस्त्रं शास्त्रं वीणा वाणी नरश्च नारी च।
पुरषविशेषं प्राप्ता भवन्त्ययोग्याश्च योग्याश्च॥
Horse, weapon, scripture, lyre, speech, man or a woman becomes worthy or unworthy depending on the person who possesses them.

title: Dainandini
description:
तावज्जितेन्द्रियो न स्याद् विजितान्येन्द्रिय: पुमान् ।
न जयेद्रसनं यावज्जितं सर्वं जिते रसे ॥
If the tongue is not conquered although all the other senses have been conquered, it cannot be said that one has conquered all senses. However, if one is able to control the tongue, he is said to be in full control of all his senses. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.21)

title: Assistant Professors of KSRI delivered guest lectures at Sri Sankara Arts and Science College
description: As a part of International Yoga Day Celebration, Sri Sankara Arts and Science College, Autonomous,  organised Yoga Demonstration and lecture program sponsored by Indian Council of Philosophical Research (ICPR) on 12.07.2022. Dr. P. C. Muralidharan, gave a talk on Vaishnavism and Patanjala Yoga, Dr. V. Preethi gave a lecture on Natha- Saiva Yoga and Gorakshanatha.

title: KĀŚYAPA SAMHITĀ – TEXT ON VIṢACIKITSĀ: A CRITICAL STUDY – Ph.D. thesis Submitted to the University of Madras
description: Goda Devi S., Ph.D. Research Scholar, KSRI,  with the guidance of Dr. V. Kameswari, submitted her Ph.D. thesis on "KĀŚYAPA SAMHITĀ – TEXT ON VIṢACIKITSĀ: A CRITICAL STUDY" to the University of Madras  on 06.07.2022

title: CRITICAL STUDY OF THE PLAY PRASANNARĀGHAVA OF JAYADEVA - Ph.D. Thesis Submitted to the University of Madras
description: Mrs. Bhuvaneswari, Ph.D. Research Scholar, KSRI,  submitted her Ph.D. thesis under the guidance of Dr. V. Kameswari on "CRITICAL STUDY OF THE PLAY PRASANNARĀGHAVA OF JAYADEVA" to the University of Madras on 17.06.2022

title: 164th Annual Convocation of University of Madras
description: Dr. V. Preethi, Asst. Professor of KSRI, received her  Ph.D. Degree from the hands of  H'ble Tamil Nadu Governor, Mr. R.N. Ravi at the 164th Annual Convocation of University of Madras, which  was held on 16.05.2022, H'ble  Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu, Mr. M.K. Stalin presided as a Chief guest,

title: Dainandini
description:
अकर्तव्यं न कर्तव्यं प्राणैः कण्ठगतैरपि।
कर्तव्यमेव कर्तव्यं प्राणैः कण्ठगतैरपि॥
Whatever is not right to be done, must never be done even if death would befall; and what is right to be done must be done even if one should die for the same.

title: Dainandini
description:
तप्यन्ते लोकतापेन साधवः प्रायशो जनाः।
परमाराधनं तद्धि पुरुषस्याखिलात्मनः॥
It is said that great people accept suffering voluntarily, due to the extreme suffering of the world at large. This is considered as the highest method of worshipping the Supreme One who dwells in each one of our hearts. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VIII.7.44)

title: Dainandini
description:
अरावप्युचितं कार्यमातिथ्ये गृहमागते ।
छेत्तुः पार्श्वगतां छायां नोपसंहरते द्रुमः॥
Even if a person happens to be our enemy, he should be treated courteously as is due to a guest when he comes to our house. For even a tree does not deny its shade to the one who cuts it.

title: Dainandini
description:
तथारिभिर्न व्यथते शिलीमुखैः
शेतेऽर्दिताङ्गो हृदयेन दूयता।
स्वानां यथा वक्रधियां दुरुक्तिभिः
दिवानिशं तप्यति मर्मताडितः॥
If one gets hurt by the arrows of an enemy, he is not as pained as when he is hurt by the sharp words of a relative, for such pain continues to taunt one's heart day and night. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.IV.3.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
यः समुत्पतितं क्रोधं निगृह्णाति हयं यथा ।
स यन्तेत्युच्यते सद्भिर्न यो रश्मिषु लम्बते॥
A wise man subdues his anger as a true charioteer holds tightly the reins of the horses.

title: Dainandini
description:
जीवितं मरणं जन्तोर्गतिः स्वेनैव कर्मणा।
राजंस्ततोऽन्योनान्यस्य प्रदाता सुखदुःखयोः॥
The life and death of a soul that manifests on earth, as well as its destination in his next life, are all decided by his own habits and activities (karma). Therefore, no other person is responsible for creating one's happiness and sorrow. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XII.6.25)

title: Dainandini
description:
क्षोभितो विबुधैः कश्चिद्गम्भीरमधुराशयः।
चन्द्ररत्नगजाश्वादिसहितां दिशति श्रियम्॥
A certain person, kind and generous, hailed of munificence by the scholars offers wealth with gold, gem, elephant, horses etc.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
मैत्रोऽथ शीलसम्पन्नः प्रसन्नात्माऽऽत्मविच्च यः।
मुक्तस्य विविधैः सङ्गैस्तस्य प्रेत्यं फलं महत्॥
Practising universal friendliness, and virtuous conduct, and possessed of cheerful spirit and psychic knowledge, and freed from the various material things, a person acquires great reward in the next world.

title: Dainandini
description:
जिह्वयातिप्रमाथिन्या जनो रसविमोहितः।
मृत्युमृच्छत्यसद्बुद्धिर्मीनस्तु बडिशैर्यथा॥
Just as a fish which is incited by the joy to enjoy his sense of taste, is fatally trapped in the fisherman's bait, similarly, a foolish person is attracted by the sense of taste of the material world and thus perishes. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
मुख्यदानोदकक्लिन्नकरः ख्यातक्षमाधृतिः।
लोकपालाश्रितः कश्चिदनाशावारणः कथम्॥
How can a person, whose hands are always wet with water for the sake of offering charity, whose forbearance and courage are famous, who is being sought by learned men, spoil the hopes of people who come to him with a purpose. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
आत्मनो मुखदोषेण बध्यन्ते शुकसारिका: ।
बकास्तत्र न बध्यन्ते मौनं सर्वार्थसाधनम्॥
Parrots and starlings are kept in cages for the fault of their speech but not the cranes.Silence is a tool for accomplishment of all objects.

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठा भूतानां प्रज्ञा लाभः परो मतः।
प्रज्ञा निःश्रेयसो लोके प्रज्ञा स्वर्गो मतस्सताम्॥
Knowledge is the basis for beings; knowledge is considered the greatest acquisition; knowledge is the greatest happpiness in the world; knowledge is considered by the good as heaven.

title: Dainandini
description:
येषां हिरण्यकशिपुक्षेत्रदानकरः करः।
तेषां तिर्यङ्मुखत्वेऽपि पुरुषत्वं न हीयते॥
Those whose hands offer gold, garments, land etc., do not lose their munificence if they are turned down. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
गुरुर्न स स्यात्स्वजनो न स स्यात्
पिता न स स्याज्जननी न सा स्यात्।
दैवं न तत्स्यान्न पतिश्च स स्यात्
नमो चयेद्यः समुपेत मृत्युम्॥
One who cannot help his devotees cross the repeated cycle of birth and death can neither become a Guru, a relative, a father, a mother, a demigod nor a husband.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.V.5.18)

title: Dainandini
description:
निर्मुक्तभवनक्षेत्राः स्युः सदागतिनिर्वृताः।
प्राप्ते भयविपर्यासे भोगिनःखलु भोगिनः॥
Having relinquished ( their) abode, land, contented by the visits of supplicants, great men, in fact are at ease due to the absence of fear of poverty.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
पण्डिते वाऽतिमूर्खे वा दरिद्रे वा श्रियाऽन्विते ।
दुर्वृते वा यतौ वाऽपि मृत्यो: सर्वत्र तुल्यता ॥
Death is common to all irrespective of being either learned or a fool, poor or rich, wicked or ascetic.

title: Dainandini
description:
किं प्रमत्तस्य बहुभिः परोक्षैर्हार्यनैरिह।
वरं मुहूर्तं विदितं घटेत श्रेयसे यतः॥
What is the use of a prolonged life which is wasted and inexperienced? Better, is a moment of absolute consciousness, which takes us on the path of realising the eternal truth. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.II.1.12)

title: Dainandini
description:
अप्यनावर्जिताः स्वेन फलरागेण सन्नताः।
अर्भकैरपि गृह्यन्ते साधुसन्तानशाखिनः॥
Great men, like the lofty celestial trees, bow down due to weights of their merits ( fruits) enable even children to reap the benefits. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
नाकाले म्रियते कश्चिद्वज्रेणापि समाहत: ।
मृत्युकालेऽमृतं जन्तोर्विषतां प्रतिपद्यते॥
No one dies even when struck with the thunderbolt if the time for death has not arrived. When it is the time for death, even nectar turns into poison.

title: Dainandini
description:
अभिमुख्यदशामात्रादादर्श इव सज्जनः।
शीघ्रं रक्तमरक्तं वा गृह्णाति स्वप्रसादतः॥
The noble person, like the mirror reflecting the objects in its front, accepts or adopts at once the one seeking favour or the other, by his magnanimity. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.1)

title: Dainandini
description:
नास्ति विद्यासमं चक्षुर्नास्ति सत्यसमं तपः।
नास्ति रागसमं दुःखं नास्ति त्यागसमं सुखम्॥
There is no eye equal to learning, no penance equal to truth, no misery like passion, no happiness like sacrifice.

title: Dainandini
description:
किं दुर्मर्षं तितिक्षूणां किमकार्यमसाधुभिः।
किं न देयं वदान्यानां कःपरः समदर्शिनाम्॥
What can a tolerant person not bear? What can a wicked person not scheme? What will a generous person not give in charity? And who will those with samabhäva (equal vision) see as an outsider? (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.72.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
पुत्रा इव पितुर्गेहे विषये यस्य मानवाः।
निर्भया विचरिष्यन्ति स राजा राजसत्तमः॥
That king is the best king in whose country, the people move without fear, like sons in their father's house.

title: Dainandini
description:
विधौ लब्धधृतिर्नीत्या विनतानन्दनो द्विजः।
नियम्यमानैः स्थानेषु भुजगैरपि भूष्यते॥
A person established in statecraft, adept in carrying out acts, modest, is revered even by rogues appointed in respective positions. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
कालो बलीयान्बलिनां भगवानीश्वरोऽव्ययः।
प्रजाः कालयते क्रीडन्पशुपालो यथा पशून्॥
Inexhaustible time, which is stronger than the strong, is the Supreme Personality of God. Like a herdsman who moves his animals along, he moves mortal creatures as his Divine play. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.51.19)

title: Dainandini
description:
नास्ति विद्यासमं चक्षुर्नास्ति सत्यसमं तपः।
नास्ति रागसमं दुःखं नास्ति त्यागसमं सुखम्॥
There is no eye equal to learning, no penance equal to truth, no misery like passion, no happiness like sacrifice.

title: Dainandini
description:
कामाधिकरणग्राह्यकुलादिबलशालिनः।
अहीनेऽपि नरेन्द्रस्य शक्तयः सिद्धिहेतवः॥
The three fold strength of the Monarch who had acquired the fame of victorious predecessors ( his ancestors) are the source of victory even during the battle with a powerful King. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
पय:पानं भुजङ्गानां केवलं विषवर्धनम्।
उपदेशो हि मूर्खाणां प्रकोपाय न शान्तये॥
Advice given to fools is like feeding the serpents with milk. It only adds to provocation rather than pacification.

title: Dainandini
description:
कामाधिकरणग्राह्यकुलादिबलशालिनः।
अहीनेऽपि नरेन्द्रस्य शक्तयः सिद्धिहेतवः॥
The three fold strength of the Monarch who had acquired the fame of victorious predecessors ( his ancestors) are the source of victory even during the battle with a powerful King. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
यदा न कुरुते धीरः सर्वभूतेषु पापकम्।
कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते परम्॥
When a man of wisdom does not commit sin against any being, in act, mind or speech, he becomes the Supreme Brahman.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनाहूत: प्रविशति अपृष्टो बहु भाषते।
अविश्वस्ते विश्वसिति मूढचेता नराधम:॥
One who, enters unasked, speaks unsolicited words and has confidence in untrustworthy persons, is said to be the worst among fools.

title: Dainandini
description:
दमेन सदृशं धर्मं नान्यं लोकेषु शुश्रुम।
दमो हि परमो लोके प्रशस्तः सर्वधर्मिणाम्॥
There is no other duty in all the worlds equal to self-control. Self-control, according to all virtuous persons, is the highest virtue in this world.

title: Dainandini
description:
पार्थिवानां पदार्थानां स्वभूत्या चक्रवर्तिनाम्।
जनयत्यचिराद्भेदं छिद्रेण महतान्वयः॥
The riches or the prosperity of the Monarchs and their family- by their abundance, generate soon rifts ( due to quarrels among them). (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
कर्मणा जायते जन्तुः कर्मणैव निलीयते।
सुखं दुःखं भयं क्षेमं कर्मणैवाभिपद्यते॥
It is by the Law of Karma that a living being takes birth, and it is by Karma alone, that a living being meets his destruction. His happiness, sorrow, fear, and sense of security arise as the effects of Karma. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
महान्तं पुरुषं प्राप्य कंचित्सत्वप्रवर्तकम्।
प्रतिबुद्धो जनस्तेन परमं साम्यमश्नुते॥
A Person, having approached a noble one who imparts virtues, becomes enlightened by him and identical with him.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
दमात् तस्य क्रियासिद्धिर्यथावदुपलभ्यते।
दमो दानं तथा यज्ञानाधीतं चातिवर्तते॥
It is from self-control that one acquires due fruits of his action. Self-control surpasses (in merit) charity and sacrifice and study of the Vedas. ( Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.160.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्या शौर्यं च दाक्ष्य च बलं धैर्यं च पञ्चमम्।
मित्राणि सहजान्याहुर्वर्तयन्ति हि तैर्बुधा:॥
Learning, valour, skill, strength and the fortitude are said to be natural friends. The wise base their mode of living on them.

title: Dainandini
description:
लोहयुक्तं यथा हेम विपक्वं न विराजते।
तथापक्वकषायाख्यं विज्ञानं न प्रकाशते॥
As gold, when united with iron, loses its purity and cannot shine, so knowledge when existing with attachment to earthly objects fails to display its splendour. ( Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.212.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
आशाया ये दासास्ते दासाः सर्वलोकस्य।
आशा दासी येषां तेषां दासायते लोकः॥
Those who are subservient to desires are slaves to the whole world. For those to whom the desires are the slaves, the world also becomes their slave.

title: Dainandini
description:
जनयत्यनले दाहं शमयत्यपि तोयदे।
अभिन्नैः स्थीयते पुण्यैराश्रमारण्यपादपैः॥
Trees which are seen on the land of a hermitage remain unharmed nor destroyed unlike other trees grown in the forest.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावानव्ययो धर्मः पुण्यश्लोकैरुपासितः।
यो भूतशोकहर्षाभ्यामात्मा शोचति हृष्यति॥
When a person feels unhappy to see the distress of other living beings and is happy to see their happiness, such a person is regarded as imperishable by great ones, who are considered to be pious and loving. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.VI.10.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
कोऽतिभारः समर्थानां किं दूरं व्यवसायिनाम्।
को विदेशः सविद्यानां कः परः प्रियवादिनाम्॥
To the talented, what is the burden? To the industrious, what is distance? To the learned, no land is strange. To the soft spoken, no one is an alien.

title: Dainandini
description:
कोऽतिभारः समर्थानां किं दूरं व्यवसायिनाम्।
को विदेशः सविद्यानां कः परः प्रियवादिनाम्॥
To the talented, what is the burden? To the industrious, what is distance? To the learned, no land is strange. To the soft spoken, no one is an alien.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतावत्येव शुश्रूषा कार्या पितरि पुत्रकैः।
वाढमित्यनुमन्येत गौरवेण गुरोर्वचः॥
Children should obey the instructions of their father to its complete extent. One must obey the command of his father or spiritual master with due deference. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.24.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं वेदेषु जागर्ति फलं सत्ये परं स्मृतम्।
सत्याद् धर्मो दमश्चैव सर्वं सत्ये प्रतिष्ठितम्॥
Truth is awake in the Vedas. The fruit attached to truth has been described as the highest. From truth originate righteousness and self-control. Everything is established in truth. ( Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.199.65)

title: Dainandini
description:
माता गुरुतरा भूमे: खात् पितोच्चतरस्तथा।
मन: शीघ्रतरं वाताच्चिन्ता बहुतरी तृणात्॥
Mother is mightier than the earth; father is loftier than the sky; mind is faster than the wind but thought is lighter than a straw.

title: Dainandini
description:
माता गुरुतरा भूमे: खात् पितोच्चतरस्तथा।
मन: शीघ्रतरं वाताच्चिन्ता बहुतरी तृणात्॥
Mother is mightier than the earth; father is loftier than the sky; mind is faster than the wind but thought is lighter than a straw.

title: Dainandini
description:
स्वदृष्टिप्रतिघातेऽपि स्वच्छे क्वचन शोभनः।
तत्र ह्यभिमुखः स्वात्मा झटित्येव प्रकाशते॥
The impaired vision of one in some instances becomes beneficial, for, the radiance of self at once reflects in his presence ( instantly). (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.4)

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं ब्रह्म तपः सत्यं सत्यं विसृजते प्रजाः।
सत्येन धार्यते लोकः स्वर्गं सत्येन गच्छति॥
Truth is Brahma; truth is penance, it is truth which creates all creatures. The world is governed by truth and one goes to heavens by (adhering to) truth.( Yogavāsiṣṭhaṁ.190.1)

title: Dainandini
description:
अमृतस्यन्दिनं कश्चित्कृष्णमेघं द्विजः स्मरन्।
उदन्यया न वेशन्तमुदन्वन्तं च वीक्षते॥
Contemplating on the dense cloud that pours nectarine water, a certain bird (cātaka) does not look at either the pond or the Ocean.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.10)

title: Proceedings of the Annual Conference on the History and Development of Mathematics,  has been published by National Mission for Manuscripts
description: The Samskrita Academy, Chennai in collaboration with the National Mission for Manuscripts (NMM) and the Mathematics Department of Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswati Vishwa Mahavidyalaya, Enathur under the auspices  of the Indian Society for History of Mathematics had organized the Annual Conference on The History and Development of Mathematics from November 27 to 29, 2018. The Proceedings of the conference has been published and brought out this May 2022.  This book has been edited by Dr.  Sita Sundar Ram, Secretary , The Samskrita Academy, Chennai and Dr. V. Ramakalyani,  Project Consultant, HoMI Project, IIT, Gandhinagar & Member, The Samskrita Academy, Chennai.  various National and International scholars as well as students from Mathematics Department of SCSVMV have contributed articles.

title: Proceedings of the Annual Conference on the History and Development of Mathematics,  has been published National Mission for Manuscripts
description: The Samskrita Academy, Chennai in collaboration with the National Mission for Manuscripts (NMM) and the Mathematics Department of Sri Chandrasekharendra Saraswti Vishwa Mahavidyalaya, Enathur had organized the Annual Conference on The History and Development of Mathematics from November 27 to 29, 2018.  Scholars from KSRI presented the papers. The Proceedings of the conference has been published during March 2022.

title: Dainandini
description:
एतदेव हि सच्छिष्यैः कर्तव्यं गुरुनिष्कृतम्।
यद्वै विशुद्धभावेन सर्वार्थात्मार्पणं गुरौ॥
The duty of all disciples is to repay their debt to the spiritual master by giving them wealth as well as surrender their life to them with a pure heart. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.80.42)

title: Dainandini
description:
अहार्येण कदाप्यन्यैरसंहार्येण केनचित्।
तितिक्षाकवचेनैव सर्वं जयति संवृतः॥
A person covering himself with the armour of endurance which cannot be carried away by others, accomplishes everything. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.9)

title: Dainandini
description:
एकः प्रसूयते जन्तुरेक एव प्रलीयते।
एकोऽनुभुङ्क्ते सुकृतमेक एव च दुष्कृतम्॥
Every creature in this world is born alone and dies alone. Alone, he experiences the fair reward for his good and bad deeds. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.49.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं दुःखस्यानन्तरं सुखम्।
न नित्यं लभते दुःखं न नित्यं लभते सुखम्॥
Sorrow comes after happiness and happiness after sorrow. One does not always suffer sorrow or always enjoy happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
जनयत्यनले दाहं शमयत्यपि तोयदे।
अभिन्नैः स्थीयते पुण्यैराश्रमारण्यपादपैः॥
Trees which are seen on the land of a hermitage remain unharmed nor destroyed unlike other trees grown in the forest. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.8)

title: Dainandini
description:
गुरुपत्नी राजपत्नी ज्येष्ठपत्नी तथैव च।
पत्नीमाता स्वमाता च पञ्चैता मातर: स्मृता:॥
Teacher's wife, King's wife, Elder brother's wife, Wife's mother and one's own mother – these five are to be considered as mothers.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनङ्गीकृतकामानामनुमानार्हवर्ष्मणाम्।
धृतनिर्मलतीर्थानां भूतिलेपो विभूषणम्॥
Wealth which is seen with persons who practice detachment, their unblemished knowledge in Sastras, happiness, their undiminished spirit of showing devotion to Lord all these are considered to be the ornaments for them.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.6.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
त्यागो गुणो वित्तवतां वित्तं त्यागवतां गुणः।
परस्परवियुक्तौ तु वित्तत्त्यागौ विडम्बना॥
The identity (merit) of a wealthy person is to sacrifice (charity to others). These two attributes, wealth and sacrifice, when they are separated from each other, becomes a mockery.

title: Dainandini
description:
मुक्तानुगुणवृत्तानां भजतां पावनीं गतिम्।
नित्यं विष्णुपदे वृत्तिस्तारकाणां सितात्मनाम्॥
Men, who follow the sacred path having renounced their worldly pleasures, pure in their heart with noble nature, helping their fellow beings in crossing the ocean of samsara, are always seen being engaged upon contemplating the lotus feet of Lord and uttering his names. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.6.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्यतस्य हि कामस्य प्रतिवादो न शस्यते।
अपि निर्मुक्तसङ्गस्य कामरक्तस्य किं पुनः॥
To deny an offering that has come your way by itself, is not commendable even for a person who is absolutely free from the attachements of sensual pleasures, much less than one who is addicted to sensual pleasures.(Srīmad Bhāgavatam.III.22.12)

title: Deputy Director of KSRI delivered a lecture on Yoga at Meenakshi Academy of Higher Education and Research, Chennai
description: MEENAKSHI Academy of Higher Education & Research (Deemed to be University) selected by Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga (MDNIY), Ministry of Ayush, Govt. of India, New Delhi organized a Webinar for Yoga Mahotsav- 2022 on 28th April 2022. Dr. K. S. Balasubramaniam, Deputy Director of KSRI, delivered a Guest lecture on "Yoga for Total Well- being".

title: Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor of KSRI, Delivered a guest lecture at Dr. MGR-JANAKI College of Arts and Science for Women
description: The Department of Sanskrit, Dr. MGR-JANAKI College of Arts and Science for Women organised a Guest lecture on 28th March 2022. Dr. V. Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor, KSRI delivered a lecture on "Sanskrit Literature: Reflection of Life Changes".

title: Proceedings of the National Conference on The Mahabharata, In Indian Art and Culture has been published by C.P. R. Institute of Indological Research
description: The C.P. Ramaswami Aiyar Foundation, had organized the National Conference on The Mahabharata - In Indian Art and Culture from March 14 to 16, 2019. Nearly 20 Scholars from KSRI presented the papers. The Proceedings of the conference has been published during March 2022.

title: Scholars of KSRI presented papers in National Conference
description: From 26th to 28th February 2022 Scholars of KSRI has been participated and presented Research articles at the three days National  conference on Indian Scientific Heritage organised by Hindu College, Sonipat
content:
1. Dr.V.Yamuna Devi, Assistant Professor, KSRI, presented a paper on "Some Fundamental Concepts of Chemistry and Physics as gleaned from texts of Ayurveda and Nyaya".
  2. Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Assistant Professor, KSRI presented the paper on "Dress and Ornaments as noted by Panini".
  3. Dr. V. Preethi, Assistant Professor, KSRI, presented a paper on "Plant Propagation".
  4. Ms. Lavanya V. Eswar, Ph.D. Research Scholar, KSRI, presented a paper on "Water Divining".
  5. Ms. S. Madhurambika, Ph.D. Research Scholar, KSRI, presented a paper on "Peacock in Sanskrit Literature".

title: Dainandini
description:
दानशीलो भवेद्राजा यज्ञशीलश्च भारत।
उपवासतपश्शीलः प्रजानां पालने रतः॥
Intent on protecting the subjects (people), the king should adhere to austerities of observing fasts.

title: Dainandini
description:
ईश्वराणां वचःसत्यं तथैवाचरितं क्वचित्।
तेषां यत्स्ववचोयुक्तं बुद्धिमांस्तत्समाचरेत्॥
The statements of the Lord's empowered disciples are always true, and the acts they perform are exemplary when it is consistent with those statements. Therefore one who is intelligent should carry out their instructions. (Sr.Bh.X.33.32)

title: Dainandini
description:
षड् दोषा पुरुषेणेह हातव्या भूतिमिचछता ।
निद्रा तन्द्री भयं क्रोधं आलस्यं दीर्घसूत्रता॥
One who aspires for prosperity should avoid the following six evils: excessive sleep, lassitude, fear, anger, indolence and procrastination.

title: Dainandini
description:
नाधनो धर्मकृत्यानि यथावदनुतिष्ठति।
धनाद्धि धर्मो निस्रौति शैलाद्गिरिनदी यथा॥
The man who has no wealth cannot carry out religious acts, for these originate from wealth, like rivers from a mountain.

title: Deputy Director of KSRI delivered lectures on Yoga at various  Universities
description: From 16th March  2022 till 29th April  2022 Dr. K.S. Balasubramaniam, Deputy Director of KSRI has been giving online lectures on Yoga in various national and International Universities.
content: <ol><li>Lecture on "<strong><em>Antiquity of Yoga<!slash!em><!slash!strong>" , at the <strong>International Yoga Utsav <!slash!strong>organised by the Universal Yoga Consciousness , Rishikesh, 16th March 2022.<!slash!li><li>Lecture on "<strong><em>Yoga Metaphysics<!slash!em><!slash!strong><em>"<!slash!em> at the conference on <strong>Yoga and Ayurveda for lifestyle diseases<!slash!strong>, organised by the Universal Yoga Consciousness, an online Global Yoga Fest, on 26 th March, 2022.<!slash!li><li>Lecture on "<strong><em>Literature on the Yogasutra of Patanjali in Sanskrit<!slash!em><!slash!strong><em> "<!slash!em> at the Three day National Workshop on <strong>Literature on The Yogasutra of Patanjali<!slash!strong>, organised by the School of Indian Languages, Madurai Kamaraj University, sponsored by Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan 2.0 (National Higher Education Mission) on 08th April, 2022.<!slash!li><li>Series of four online talks on "<strong style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);"><em>Patanjali's Yoga Sutras" <!slash!em><!slash!strong><span style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">at <!slash!span><strong style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">West Washington Universities, USA, <!slash!strong><span style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">on 8th, 15th, 22nd and 29th of April 2022 <!slash!span><!slash!li><!slash!ol>

title: Dainandini
description:
बोद्धारो मत्सरग्रस्ताः प्रभवः स्मयदूषिताः।
अबोधोपहताश्चान्ये जीर्णमङ्गे सुभाषितम्॥
The learned ones are jealous, kings are spoiled because of arrogance, the rest are ignorant, hence wise sayings perish in the body itself.

title: Dainandini
description:
आचार्यात्पादमादत्ते पादं शिष्यः स्वमेधया।
पादं सब्रह्मचारिभ्यः पादं कालक्रमेण च ॥
One fourth of one's learning is from the preceptor; one fourth comes from one's own intelligence; another fourth is derived from one's fellow seekers, and another quarter accrues from the passage of time.

title: Scholars of KSRI presenting papers in Conferences
description: From March 26-27 2022 till April 17th 2022 Scholars of KSRI have been participationg in various conferences and presenting Research articles.
content: <ol><li>Dr.V.Yamuna Devi, presented a paper on "<em>The Two less-known Women Role Models of the 17-18<!slash!em><sup><em>th<!slash!em><!slash!sup><em> Cent. C.E. Queen Dīpāmbā – the Diplomat and Āvuḍai Akkā- the Advait<!slash!em>in" , at the <strong>conference on Feminine in Hinduism <!slash!strong>organised by the Indic Academy held at Cotton University, Guwahati, Assam, 26-27th March 2022.<!slash!li><li>Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, presented the paper on "<em>Yoga in Vishishtadvaita Philosophy"<!slash!em> at the conference on <strong>Yoga and Ayurveda for lifestyle diseases<!slash!strong>, organised by the Universal Yoga Conciousness, an online Global Yoga Fest, on 26 th March, 2022.<!slash!li><li>Dr.V.Yamuna Devi presented a paper on "The health benefits of chewing Tambulam" at the National level Webinar on <strong>The roots of Modern science in Veda Samskrita Vanmayam, Hyderabad"<!slash!strong> organised by The Veda Samskriti Samiti on 10<sup>th<!slash!sup> April, 2022.<!slash!li><li>Ms. R.Gayathri, M.Phil Research Scholar of KSRI presented a paper titled "<em style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">An Introduction to Sanskrit Diary Literature"  at<!slash!em><span style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);"> the Student's National Seminar <!slash!span><strong style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">" Sanskrit Studies in the 21st Century"<!slash!strong><span style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);"> organised by the Chinmaya Vishwavidyapeeth and was awarded the <!slash!span><strong style="color: rgb(32, 18, 77);">Third Prize for her research paper presentation.<!slash!strong><!slash!li><li>Dr. V. Preethi presented a peper on "<em>Ancient Indian knowledge of Oceanography<!slash!em>" at the National level Webinar on <strong>The roots of Modern science in Veda Samskrita Vanmayam, Hyderabad"<!slash!strong> organised by The Veda Samskriti Samiti on 17<sup>th<!slash!sup> April, 2022.<!slash!li><!slash!ol>

title: Dainandini
description:
न कश्चिदपि जानाति किं कस्य श्वो भविष्यति।
अतः श्वः करणीयानि कुर्यादद्यैव बुद्धिमान् ॥
No one knows what will happen to whom the next day. Therefore let the wise man do today itself what is planned for tomorrow.

title: Dainandini
description:
इन्द्रियाणि जयन्त्याशु निराहारा मनीषिणः।
वर्जयित्वा तु रसनं तन्निरन्नस्य वर्धते॥
If one artificially tries to give up sense gratification, especially that of the tongue, the attempt will be a failure, and in fact one's desire for sense gratification will increase as a result of artificial deprivation. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.XI.8.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
एकेन राजहंसेन या शोभा सरसो भवेत्।
न सा बक सहस्रेण परितस्तीरवासिना॥
The beauty and charm that ponds have in the presence of just one royal swan is not attained even by the presence of thousands of cranes living all around the lake.

title: Dainandini
description:
अर्थेनापि विहीनस्य पुरुषस्याल्पचेतसः।
विच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियास्सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा॥
All acts of a person, who endowed with little intelligence allows himself to be divested of wealth, are all dried up like shallow rivers in the summer.

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्योगे नास्ति दारिद्रयं जपतो नास्ति पातकम्।
मौने च कलहो नास्ति नास्ति जागरितो भयम् ॥
When there is hard work there is no poverty; chanting of mantras dissolves one's sins; by observing silence there is no quarrel and there is no fear when one is alert.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयुः श्रियं यशो धर्म लोकानाशिष एव च।
हन्ति श्रेयांसि सर्वाणि पुंसो महदतिक्रमः॥
When a man abuses great souls, his blessings of longevity, beauty, fame, dharma and promotion to higher pursuits of life will be destroyed. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam.X.4.46)

title: Dainandini
description:
अरयोऽपि हि संधेयाः सति कार्यार्थगौरवे।
अहिमूषकवद्देवा ह्यर्थस्य पदवीं गतैः॥
O Devas, fulfilling one's interest is so important that you may have to enter into a treaty with your enemies. For the sake of upholding one's interest, one has to use the logic of the snake and the mouse. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam VII.6.20)

title: Dainandini
description:
अहो दैन्यमहो कष्टं पारक्यैः क्षणभंगुरैः।
यन्नोपकुर्यादस्वार्थैर्मर्त्यः स्वज्ञातिविग्रहैः॥
The body which is actually consumed by jackals and dogs after my death, does no good for me. It is perishable, and can be used only for a short time. The body, it's possessions, it's riches and relatives should be used for the benefit of uplifting others. Else, they will be sources of tribulations and misery. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam VI.10.10)

title: Dainandini
description:
असतः श्रीमदान्धस्य दारिद्र्यं परमञ्जनम्।
आत्मौपम्येन भूतानि दरिद्रः परमीक्षते॥
Atheists, who are very proud of their wealth, fail to see things as they are. Therefore, making them poor is the suitable ointment to their eyes, so they may see things as they are. At least, a man who is struck by poverty can realise how painful it is, therefore, will not want others to be in a painful condition like his own. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam X.10.13)

title: Dainandini
description:
अरयोऽपि हि संधेयाः सति कार्यार्थगौरवे।
अहिमूषकवद्देवा ह्यर्थस्य पदवीं गतैः॥
O Devas, fulfilling one's interest is so important that you may have to enter into a treaty with your enemies. For the sake of upholding one's interest, one has to use the logic of the snake and the mouse.

title: Dainandini
description:
उद्योगिनं पुरुषसिंहमुपैति लक्ष्मीः
दैवं हि दैन्यमिति कापुरुषाः वदन्ति।br</>
    दैवं निहत्य कुरु  पौरुषमात्म शक्त्या
यत्ने कृते यदि न सिध्यति कोऽत्र दोषः॥br</>
Wealth always reaches only those lion-like people who persistently keep trying and continuously toil. But some people consider poverty and misery as fate. One can overcome fate through continuous efforts. Even after trying hard, if one does not succeed, one should find out where the fault lies.

title: Dainandini
description:
कालक्रमेण जगत: परिवर्तमाना।
चक्रारपङ्क्तिरिव गच्छति भाग्यपङ्क्ति:॥
The cycle of worldly fortune revolves like the set of spokes in a charriot wheel.

title: Dainandini
description:
आचारः कुलमाख्याति देशमाख्यति भाषणम्।
सम्भ्रमः स्नेह माख्यति वपुराख्याति भोजनम् ॥
The good conduct of a person reveals the lineage; his language reveals his nationality; the way one receives the guest reveals his love; and one's physical form reveals the nature and the quality of food he consumes.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनुव्रतानां शिष्याणां पुत्राणां च द्विजोत्तम |
अनापृष्टमपिब्रूयु र्गुरवो दीनवत्सलाः॥
O Blessed one! Spiritual masters are very kind to the needy people, to their disciples, and to their sons, and impart all that is known to them, without being asked.

title: Dainandini
description:
आपत्सु मित्रं जानीयात् युद्धे शूरमृणे शुचिम्।
भार्यां क्षीणेषु वित्तेषु व्यसनेषु च बान्धवम्॥
One can know a true friend during the time of crisis; a person's bravery in the battle field; honesty in the manner he returns his loan; a spouse in the way she behaves during financial crisis; and the true nature of relatives at the time of calamity.

title: Dainandini
description:
तुल्ये प्रियाप्रिये यस्य सुखदु:खे तथैव च।
अतीतानागते चोभे स वै सर्वधनी नर:॥
One who treats likes and dislikes, pleasure and pain; and past and future, with equanimity, possess all the wealth.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनागतमतीतं च वर्तमानमतीन्द्रियम्।
विप्रकृष्टं व्यवहितं सम्यक्पश्यन्ति योगिनः॥
Mystic Yogis have the ability to clearly perceive the past, present and the future. They have the capacity to look beyond the purview of the senses, even though remote or blocked by physical obstacles. (Srīmad Bhāgavatam X.61.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अन्यायोपार्जितं वित्तं दशवर्षाणि तिष्ठति ।
प्राप्ते चैकादशे वर्षे समूलञ्च विनश्यति ॥
The wealth, earned through dishonest and unfair means may last for a short period of ten years. Later the ill-gotten money will vanish in totality.

title: Dainandini
description:
अभिवादन शीलस्य नित्यं वृद्धोपसेविनः।
चत्वारि तस्य वर्धन्ते आयुर्विद्या यशो बलम्॥
For the one who offers respect and renders service to the elders, these four prosper in him – life span, knowledge, fame and health.

title: Dainandini
description:
सन्तोषामृततृप्तानां यत्सुखं शान्तचेतसाम्।
कुतस्तद्धनलुब्धानामितश्चेतश्च धावताम्॥
Happiness is in the possession of those who are contended and whose minds are in tranquility.Those who are in greed of wealth do not get the happiness, how much ever they try.

title: Dainandini
description:
अण्वप्युपाहृतं भक्तैः प्रेम्णा भूर्येव मे भवेत्।
भूर्यप्यभक्तोपहृतं न मे तोषाय कल्पते॥
I am very pleased with the smallest gift offered to me with love by a devotee. On the contrary, I am not pleased even when a magnificent gift offered to me by a non- devotee.

title: Dainandini
description:
अणुभ्यश्च महद्भ्यश्च शास्त्रेभ्यः कुशलो नरः।
सर्वतःसारमादद्यात्पुष्पेभ्य इव षट्पदः॥
Just as the honey bee takes in the nectar from all flowers, small and big, an intelligent man must take in the essence from all the religious scriptures.

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवा ज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनाम यत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघं पुंसो दहेदेधो यथानलः॥
Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail.

title: Dainandini
description:
न संशयं प्रपद्येत नाकस्मादप्रियं वदेत् ।
नाहितं नानृतं चैव न स्तेन: स्यान्न वार्धुषी॥
One should not be doubtful of everything; should not talk harshly for any reason; neither should one utter words which may cause harm to others or that are untrue; nor be a thief or an usurper.

title: Dainandini
description:
संसारविषवृक्षस्य द्वे एव रसवत्फले।
काव्यामृतरसास्वाद: सङ्गम: सुजनै: सह॥
Tasting the poetical nectar and the association with the good are the two sweetest fruits among the poisonous tree of worldly existence.

title: Dainandini
description:
वरं कूपशताद्वापी वरं वापीशतात्क्रतु:।
वरं क्रतुशतात्पुत्र: सत्यं पुत्रशताद्वरम्॥
A tank is superior to hundred wells; Performing a sacrifice is meritorious than digging hundred tanks; Begetting a son is more praiseworthy than hundred sacrifices. However, truth is commendable than hundred sons.

title: Dainandini
description:
सत्यं माता पिता ज्ञानं धर्मो भ्राता दया सखा।
शान्ति: पत्नी क्षमा पुत्र: षडेते मम बान्धवा:॥
Truth is my mother, knowledge my father, Dharma my brother, compassion is friend, tranquility is wife, forbearance is son – these six qualities are considered the kinship of a virtuous man.

title: Dainandini
description:
उत्साहसम्पन्नमदीर्घसूत्रं क्रियाविधिज्ञं व्यसनेष्वसक्तम्।
शूरं कृतज्ञं दृढसौहृदं च लक्ष्मीस्वयं याति निवासहेतुः॥
Goddess Lakshmi resides in one – who is energetic, who does not procrastinate, who knows the theory and practice of a thing, who is not addicted to vices, who is brave, grateful and is firm in friendship.

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्या ददाति विनयं विनायद्याति पात्रताम्।
पात्रत्वाद्धनमाप्नोति धनाद्धर्मं तत: सुखम्॥
Learning endows one with modesty; from modesty arises worthiness; being worthy brings in riches; riches begets religious merits which ultimately leads to happiness.

title: Dainandini
description:
यथा खनन् खनित्रेण नरो वार्यधिगच्छति।
तथा गुरुगतां विद्यां शुश्रूषुरधिगच्छति॥
Just as a person who digs with a spade gets water, a student with his obedience obtains knowledge from his teacher.

title: Dr. P.C. Muralidharan Presented a paper titled "Significance of Environment in the practice of Yoga"
description:
The  Indic Academy organised the Conference on Hinduism and Environmentalism .
Dr P.C.Muralidharan presented a paper on "Significance of Environment in the practice of Yoga"
content: Dr P.C.Muralidharan presented a paper on "Significance of Environment in the practice of Yoga" 0n 12th February in the online conference organised by the Indic Academy

title: Dainandini
description:
प्रायेण श्रीमतां लोके भोक्तुं शक्तिर्न विद्यते।
काष्ठान्यपि हि जीर्यन्ते दरिद्राणां च सर्वश:॥
It is very common in this world that rich men have no appetite while the poor can digest even pieces of wood

title: Dainandini
description:
नाभिषेको न संस्कार: सिंहस्य क्रियते मृगै:।
विक्रमार्जितराज्यस्य स्वयमेव मृगेन्द्रता॥
The animals do not perform any coronation or ritual for the lion to be a king but he earns the Lordship over the jungle-kingdom through his bravery.

title: Dainandini
description:
आपो वस्त्रं तिला तैलं गन्धो वा स यथा तथा।
पुष्पाणामधिवासेन तथा संसर्गजा गुणा:॥
Water, cloth, sesame seeds or oil take the fragrance of the flowers they come into contact with. It is contact that leads to emergence of qualities.

title: Dainandini
description:
संभ्रम: स्नेहमाख्याति वपुराख्याति भोजनम्।
आचार: कुलमाख्याति देशमाख्याति भाषणम्॥
Agitation bespeaks affection, physique diet, behavior lineage and speech country.

title: Dainandini
description:
शोको नाशयते धैर्यं शोको नाशयते श्रुतम् ।
शोको नाशयते सर्वं नास्ति शोकसमो रिपु : ॥
Grief destroys patience, understanding and everything. Hence there is no enemy equal to grief.

title: Dainandini
description:
अद्भिर्गात्राणि शुध्यन्ति मन: सत्येन शुध्यति ।
विद्यातपोभ्यां भूतात्मा बुद्धिर्ज्ञानेन शुध्यति॥
Body is cleansed with water; mind purified with truth; soul with study and the intellect is purified with knowledge.

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्प: क्रूर: खल: क्रूर: सर्पात् क्रूरतर: खल: ।
मन्त्रौषधिवश: सर्प: खल: केन निवार्यते॥
A serpent as well as wicked man are cruel; wicked is more cruel than the serpent. While a serpent can be subdued by mantras and herbs, there is no control for the wicked.

title: Dainandini
description:
ऋणशेषोऽग्निशेषश्च व्याधिशेषस्तथैव च ।
पुनश्च वर्धते यस्मात् तस्माच्छेषं न कारयेत्॥
Remains of a debt, fire and disease would grow again and hence these should completely be wiped out.

title: Dainandini
description:
न कश्चित्कस्यचित्मित्रं न कश्चित् कस्यचिद्रिपु:।
व्यवहारेण जायन्ते मित्राणि रिपवस्तथा॥
Nobody is anybody's friend or foe. It is only the conduct that makes friends or foes.

title: Dainandini
description:
भयेन भेदयेद् भीरुं शूरमञ्जलिकर्मणा।
लुब्धमर्थप्रदानेन समं न्यूनं तथौजसा॥
One should win over a coward by scaring him, a brave by humility, a greedy with money and the equals or inferior by showing valor.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनभ्यासे विषं विद्या अजीर्णे भोजनं विषम्।
विषं सभा दरिद्रस्य वृद्धस्य तरुणी विषम्॥
Knowledge, without constant study, is poisonous; Intake of food during indigestion turns into poison; an assembly is a poison for poor and for an old man a young woman is poison.

title: Dainandini
description:
बह्महत्यादिपापानां कथञ्चिन्निष्कृतिर्भवेत्।
विश्वासघातिनां पापं न नश्येज्जन्मकोटिभि:॥
There can be atonement for the sins like the killing of a brahmin, etc. The sin of betrayal of trust cannot be destroyed even by millions of births.

title: Dainandini
description:
विद्वत्वं वा नृपत्वं वा नैव तुल्यं कदाचन।
स्वदेशे पूज्यते राजा विद्वान् सर्वत्र पूज्यते॥
Being a scholar and a king are never at par. The king gets respect in his own country while a scholar gets it everywhere.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनार्यमार्यवृत्तेन सत्येनानृतवादितम्।
रिपुमप्युपकारेण वशीकुर्वन्ति साधव:॥
Good people win over the bad souls by their good conduct; untruthful with truth and even the enemies by favouring them.

title: Dr. K.S. Balasubramaniam, Deputy Director of KSRI introduced Daaji's book and gave a talk about Ashtanga Yoga on 29th January, 2022, "Yogutsav-Timeless wisdom" organised by Heartfulness, Chennai
description: Dr. K.S. Balasubramaniam, Deputy Director of KSRI introduced Daaji's book and spoke on the relevance of ‘Patanjali's Yoga Sutras viz., Ashtanga Yoga on the occasion of "Yogutsav- Timeless Wisdom" on 29th January 2022,  organised by Heartfulness, Chennai. The event was presided over by the Hon'ble Governor of Tamil Nadu, Thiru R. N. Ravi who launched the books ‘The Authentic Yoga' and ‘Tales from the Vedas and Upanishads' from Heartfulness.

title: Dainandini
description:
रूपयौवनसंपन्ना: विशालकुलसंभवा:।
विद्याहीना: न शोभन्ते निर्गन्धा: इव किंशुका:॥
Those who are uneducated do not shine even if they are endowed with beauty and youth and are born in renowned families just like kimśuka flowers which are beautiful but odourless.

title: Dainandini
description:
आयु: कर्म च वित्तञ्च विद्या निधनमेव च।
पञ्चैते ननु कल्प्यन्ते गर्भगत्वेन देहिनाम्॥
Longevity, deeds, prosperity, knowledge and death of a person are decided even while he is in the mother's womb.

title: Dainandini
description:
सर्प: क्रूर: खल: क्रूर: सर्पात्क्रूरतर: खल:।
मन्त्रोषधवश: सर्प: किमुदुष्टो भयङ्कर:॥
The snake and the wicked person are both dangerous. The poison of a snake can be neutralized by mantra or medicine while there is no mantra or medicine that can remove the poison of a wicked person.

title: Dainandini
description:
शकटं पञ्चहस्तेषु दशहस्तेषु वाजिनम् ।
गजं हस्तसहस्रेषु दुर्जनं दूरतस्त्यजेत्॥
This subhāṣita cautions a person to keep a distance of 5 hasta (cubits) from a vehicle, ten cubits from a horse and 1000 cubits from an elephant but to keep as much away as possible from an evil person.

title: Dainandini
description:
अपुनर्देहिशब्दार्थमप्रत्युपकृतिक्षमम्।
अर्थिनं कुरुते कश्चित्पुनरावृत्तिवर्जितम्॥
A generous man makes his supplicant so wealthy that he will never ever have to seek again and that he will never come back to him for any favour. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.8)

title: The Journal of Oriental Research Madras Volume 92 is released and available for sale
description: The Kuppuswami Sastri  Research Institute is happy in presenting to the world of scholars Volume 92 of the Journal of Oriental Research, Madras, for the year 2019 with twelve articles and more than thirty book reviews.
content:
The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is happy in bringing out the present volume 92 of the Journal of Oriental Research, Madras, for the year 2019, though belatedly brought out due to the Covid pandemic that had affected the entire world. In accordance with the orders of the Govt. of Tamilnadu, the Institute had been closed from the middle of March 2020 till Oct.2020 and again from April 2021 till August 2021. This had caused the delay in the publication of this issue which was due by April 2020.

  Amidst all the difficulties, the Editorial Board of the Journal places before the discerning readers the present volume with twelve articles and more than thirty book reviews. All the articles are of great interest: There are two articles on Yoga - one deals with “Yogic element in Hamsasandeśa of Vedāntadeśika” and the other analyses the concept of Prāṇāyāma as dealt with by the Śivasamhitā of Gorakṣanātha. Avyayas as discussed by Bhoja is continued and nipātas as avyayas is presented in this volume. While “Gold in the Rāmāyaṇa” talks about the eighteen varieties of gold found in use in Vālmīki's time, another article narrates hunting as a pastime of King Sahaji as depicted by his court poet Śrīdhara Ayyāvāl. There are three articles on Indian mathematics: (i) “Bhāskara's methods for the Vargaprakṛti equation with negative kṣepa”; (ii) “Śreḍhivyavahāra in the Gaṇitasārasaṅgraha” concentrating only on some special rules and problems involving Arithmatic progression; and (iii) the most famous ‘cow problem' found in the Gaṅitakaumudī of Narāyaṇa Paṇḍita is demonstrated on the basis of Vārasaṅkalita method of Nārāyaṇa. The South Indian tour of Vādirāja Tīrtha, Balarāma as the pioneer of Indian agriculture, etymological derivations of the constituents of Śilpivarga and Vakrokti as the means of conveying contrast form the contents of the remaining articles. Thus the articles govern different branches of learning in Sanskrit.

The volume also contains details about the various academic and extended activities of the Institute during 2019 throwing light on the academic achievements of the Institute.

The Appendix carries the second section titled ‘Cidvimśikā' of Svātmayogapradīpikā of Amarānanda with auto-commentary, critically edited by Dr.T.V. Vasudeva, Deputy Director of the Institute. By publishing this critically edited text as the supplement to the volume, the Institute has revived the practice of publishing rare texts in such a way started by Mm. Prof. S. Kuppuswami Sastri himself.

title: Dainandini
description:
क्षोभितो विबुधैः कश्चिद्गम्भीरमधुराशयः।
चन्द्ररत्नगजाश्वादिसहितां दिशति श्रियम्॥
A certain person, kind and generous, hailed of munificence by the scholars offers wealth with gold, gem, elephant, horses etc. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.7)

title: Dainandini
description:
मुख्यदानोदकक्लिन्नकरः ख्यातक्षमाधृतिः।
लोकपालाश्रितः कश्चिदनाशावारणः कथम्॥
How can a person, whose hands are always wet with water for the sake of offering charity, whose forbearance and courage are famous, who is being sought by learned men, spoil the hopes of people who come to him with a purpose. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.6)

title: Dainandini
description:
येषां हिरण्यकशिपुक्षेत्रदानकरः करः।
तेषां तिर्यङ्मुखत्वेऽपि पुरुषत्वं न हीयते॥
Those whose hands offer gold, garments, land etc., do not lose their munificence if they are turned down.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.5)

title: Dainandini
description:
निर्मुक्तभवनक्षेत्राः स्युः सदागतिनिर्वृताः।
प्राप्ते भयविपर्यासे भोगिनःखलु भोगिनः॥
Having relinquished ( their) abode, land, contented by the visits of supplicants, great men, in fact are at ease due to the absence of fear of poverty.(Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.3)

title: Dainandini
description:
अप्यनावर्जिताः स्वेन फलरागेण सन्नताः।
अर्भकैरपि गृह्यन्ते साधुसन्तानशाखिनः॥
Great men, like the lofty celestial trees, bow down due to weights of their merits ( fruits) enable even children to reap the benefits. (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.2)

title: Dainandini
description:
अभिमुख्यदशामात्रादादर्श इव सज्जनः।
शीघ्रं रक्तमरक्तं वा गृह्णाति स्वप्रसादतः॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.X.1)
The noble person, like the mirror reflecting the objects in its front, accepts or adopts at once the one seeking favour or the other, by his magnanimity.

title: Deputy Directors of KSRI gave a talk in the Webinar on 12th January 2022,  International Youth Day, organised by Unione Induista Italiana
description: Dr. K. S. Balasubramanian and Dr. T.V.V. Vasudeva, the Deputy Directors of KSRI, gave a talk in a Webinar organised by Unione Induista Italiana, Italy for the occasion of Swami Vivekananda Jayanti, International Youth Day on 12th January 2022.

title: Dr. K. Vidyuta received Best Paper Award on Three-Day National Seminar on सनातनधर्मः समाजश्रेयः
description: Dr. K. Vidyuta's, (Research Associate, KSRI), paper titled Temple Construction and Maintenance as Purta Dharma was selected as BEST PAPER among all the papers presented in the Three day National Seminar organised by the Sanskrit Academy, Osmania University, Hyderabad
content:
SANSKRIT ACADEMY (Adarsha Shodha Samstha)

Recognised by Central Sanskrit University, New Delhi

Osmania University, Hyderabad-500007 T.S

Is conducting aThree-Day National Seminar

On सनातनधर्मः समाजश्रेयः From 27th to 29th December 2021. The Scholars of KSRI are presenting papers on

different topics and presenting them online.

title: Dainandini
description:
विबुधमहिते मेरावैरावणःकरटी मुहुः
कषतु करटं कण्डूलं स्वं क्षरन्मदकर्दमम्।
भजतु च तटक्रीडां पादैर्विसन्धि रसादृढं
न च मलिनता नापि क्षोभः कलाभृति संभृतः॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.12)
May the Celestial Elephant Airavata rub the mountain Meru revered by the Gods, to get relieved of itches in the cheek and emits its miry rut, and sport in the slopes wilfully; but there is neither agitation nor pollution in the Meru ( mountain).

title: Dainandini
description:
नीतिःसती त्वयि परं परपुष्टधातुः</br>
पुत्रीकृतोऽपि बलिपुष्टकुलैर्यतस्त्वम्।</br>
दूरीकृतोऽपि पुरुषैस्तत एव काले</br>
कण्ठो यदेष तव पञ्चममुञ्चकार॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.11)
