The favour of creator holds good for you, Oh Cuckoo though nurtured by others and driven out by them at the appropriate time,  you have been blessed with this melodious voice.

title: Three-Day National Seminar on सनातनधर्मः समाजश्रेयः
description: Scholars of KSRI presenting papers in the Three day National Conference organised by the Sanskrit Academy, Hyderabad
content:
SANSKRIT ACADEMY (Adarsha Shodha Samstha)

Recognised by Central Sanskrit University, New Delhi

Osmania University, Hyderabad-500007 T.S

Is conducting aThree-Day National Seminar

On सनातनधर्मः समाजश्रेयः From 27th to 29th December 2021.  The Scholars of KSRI are presenting papers on

different topics and presenting them online.

title: Dainandini
description:
विधौ लब्धधृतिर्नीत्या विनतानन्दनो द्विजः।</br>
नियम्यमानैःस्थानेषु भुजगैरपि भूष्यते॥(Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.10)</br>
A person established in statecraft, adept in carrying out acts, modest, is revered even by rogues appointed in respective positions.

title: Association with The Indian Knowledge Systems (IKS), Division - Ministry of Education
description: The Coordinators from the IKS visited KSRI. Representatives of the KSRI attended the interactive discussions at the IIT, Madras.
content:
A team comprising of Dr. Anuradha Choudry, Assistant Professor, Department of Humanities and Social Sciences, IIT Kharagpur and the Coordinator, Indian Knowledge Systems Division along with Shri Anurag Deshpande, Research Fellow from The Indian Knowledge Systems (IKS), Division of the Ministry of Education, visited KSRI on the 17th December, Friday.

The IKS Division in collaboration with Prof. K. S. Kannan ji and Prof. Aditya K ji from the Department of Humanities and Social Sciences, IIT Madras, conducted an interactive discussion meeting with a few renowned scholars and thinkers on 18th December, Saturday. Dr.Sita Sundar Ram, Secretary, KSRI spoke about the KSRI.

On the same day, the IKS team met a larger group of IKS enthusiasts selected from Institutes, Universities and Colleges in and around Chennai. This is mainly to disseminate the IKSD objectives and call for project proposals from academic and other institutions. Dr. V Yamuna Devi and Dr. P.C. Muralidharan, Asst. Professors from the KSRI and Dr. V. Ramakalyani, Research Associate, KSRI attended the brainstorming session.

title: Dainandini
description:
कामाधिकरणग्राह्यकुलादिबलशालिनः।</br>
अहीनेऽपि नरेन्द्रस्य शक्तयः सिद्धिहेतवः॥(Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.7)</br>
The three fold strength of the Monarch who had acquired the fame of victorious predecessors ( his ancestors) are the source of victory even during the battle with a powerful King.

title: Dainandini
description:
पार्थिवानां पदार्थानां स्वभूत्या चक्रवर्तिनाम्।</br>
जनयत्यचिराद्भेदं छिद्रेण महतान्वयः॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.IX.2) </br>
The riches or the prosperity of the Monarchs and their family- by their abundance, generate soon rifts ( due to quarrels among them).

title: Dainandini
description:
महान्तं पुरुषं प्राप्य कंचित्सत्वप्रवर्तकम्। </br>
प्रतिबुद्धो जनस्तेन परमं साम्यमश्नुते॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.8) </br>
A Person, having approached a noble one who imparts virtues, becomes enlightened by him and identical with him.

title: Dainandini
description:
स्वदृष्टिप्रतिघातेऽपि स्वच्छे क्वचन शोभनः।</br>
तत्र ह्यभिमुखः स्वात्मा झटित्येव प्रकाशते॥(Subhāṣita Nīvī.VIII.4) </br>
The impaired vision of one in some instances becomes beneficial, for, the radiance of self at once reflects in his presence ( instantly).

title: Dainandini
description:
अमृतस्यन्दिनं कश्चित्कृष्णमेघं द्विजः स्मरन्।
उदन्यया न वेशन्तमुदन्वन्तं च वीक्षते॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.10) </br>
Contemplating on the dense cloud that pours nectarine water, a certain bird (cātaka) does not look at either the pond or the Ocean.

title: Dainandini
description:
अहार्येण कदाप्यन्यैरसंहार्येण केनचित्।
तितिक्षाकवचेनैव सर्वं जयति संवृतः॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.9) </br>
A person covering himself with the armour of endurance which cannot be carried away, nor destroyed by others, accomplishes everything.

title: Dainandini
description:
जनयत्यनले दाहं शमयत्यपि तोयदे।
अभिन्नैः स्थीयते पुण्यैराश्रमारण्यपादपैः॥ (Subhāṣita Nīvī.VII.8) </br>
Trees which are seen on the land of a hermitage remain unharmed nor destroyed unlike other trees grown in the forest.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनङ्गीकृतकामानामनुमानार्हवर्ष्मणाम्।
धृतनिर्मलतीर्थानां भूतिलेपो विभूषणम्॥ </br>
Wealth which is seen with persons who practice detachment, their unblemished knowledge in Sastras, happiness, their undiminished spirit of showing devotion to Lord all these are considered to be the ornaments for them.

title: Dainandini
description:
मुक्तानुगुणवृत्तानां भजतां पावनीं गतिम्।
नित्यं विष्णुपदे वृत्तिस्तारकाणां सितात्मनाम्॥ (Su.Ni.6.3)</br>
Men, who follow the sacred path having renounced their worldly pleasures, pure in their heart with noble nature, helping their fellow beings in crossing the ocean of samsara, are always seen being engaged upon contemplating the lotus feet of  Lord and uttering his names.

title: New Year Dairy - Ramayana Diary
description:
Ramayana Diary is a unique publication of the Samskrita Academy, Chennai.
New Year Gift for All
content:
The Ramayana Diary has only themonth and the date and not the day and the year with select shlokas from the Ramayana for each day. Hence it can be utilsed for all years. The Ramayana Diary can be a special gift for your near and dear ones for the upcoming years to come.

Price @ Rs 150 only.

To get the copies mail to ksrinst@gmail.com

title: Sanātana Dharma Chair instituted by Sri C.S. Vaidyanathan
description: Dr. R. Thiagarajan, former Prof. & Head, Dept. of Sanskrit, Presidency College, Chennai has been appointed to hold the Chair w.e.f. Nov. 2021.
content:
Recently Sri C.S. Vaidyanathan, senior Advocate, Supreme Court of India has created an endowment and instituted a Chair as ‘ Sanatana Dharma' to explore various aspects of Ancient Indian Culture available in Sanskrit and Tamil Literature.

Dr. R. Thiagarajan, former Prof. & Head, Dept. of Sanskrit, Presidency College, Chennai has been appointed to hold the Chair w.e.f. Nov. 2021.

 

He would collect relevant materials on religious and charitable endowments from the Veda, Smṛtis and other Sanskrit texts, inscriptions and also from Tamil Literature.

We welcome Prof. Thiagarajan as a Hon. Prof. of our Institute.

title: Dainandini 10-11-21
description:
अनुव्रतानां शिष्याणां पुत्राणां च द्विजोत्तम |
</br>
अनापृष्टमपि ब्रूयुर्गुरवो दीनवत्सलाः॥</br>
O Blessed among Brähmaëas, spiritual masters are very kind to the needy people, to their disciples, and to their sons, and ascribes all that is knowledge to them, without being asked.

title: Dainandini
description:
अनागतमतीतंचवर्तमानमतीन्द्रियम्।
विप्रकृष्टंव्यवहितंसम्यक्पश्यन्तियोगिनः॥
Mystic Yogis have the ability clearly perceive the past, present and the future. They have the capacity to look beyond the purview of the senses, even though remote or blocked by physical obstacles. 
(Ç.B.X.61.21)

title: Dainandini
description:
अज्ञानादथवाज्ञानादुत्तमश्लोकनामयत्।
सङ्कीर्तितमघंपुंसोदहेदेधोयथानलः॥(Ç.B.VI.2.18)</br>Just as fire burns dry grass into ashes, so does chanting the Sacred name of the Lord, knowingly or unknowingly, burns the reactions of one's sinful activities without fail.

title: To the kind attention of Scholars
description:
To the kind attention of Scholars!
The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute is the Sole publisher and Editor of the Journal – “The Journal of Oriental Research” Madras ( ISSN 00223301) , for the past 75 years containing articles in oriental studies, primarily Sanskrit. Our Journal has been recognized as a peer Reviewedd Journal by the UGC.
content:
It has come to our notice that some publishers are using our Journal's name and other details to publish fake journals. Scholars are cautioned not to fall prey to such deceit. For verification you may contact us through email: ksrinst@gmail.com.


It's further informed that neither the editors of the" Journal of Oriental Research" nor The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute shall take the responsibility for publication of articles in the fake journal carrying our name.


Also the FAKE Journal Publishers using our Journal's Name – ‘The Journal of Oriental Research' and other details of The Kuppuswami Sastri Research Institute, are warned hereby that we will be taking legal action against such firms!slash!individuals !slash!publishers involved in such Fraudulent activities.

title: Guru Purnima
description:
The Indic Academy marks the Guru Purnima on the full moon day of Ashadha masa by honouring 108 Gurus– Academics, Activists, Authors and Artists who have selflessly served the cause of Dharma. 
Dr.V. Kameswari, Director, KSRI was one of the Gurus honoured. This event was reported in the Dinamalar newspaper dt. 8.9.2019.

title: Shivarathri
description:
शिवरात्रिपूजा
महाशिवरात्रिं निमित्तीकृत्य चेन्नैनगरस्य नैके शिवालयेषु आरात्रौ अभिषेकादयः पूजाकार्यक्रमाः आयोजिताः आसन्। कोरोनामहामार्याः कारणेन भक्तानामागमने च निर्बन्धाः आसन् इति च ज्ञायते।तथापि मयूरपुरस्य कपालीश्वरदेवालये तथा अत्रस्थ सप्त-शिव- क्षेत्रेषु च भक्ताः पूजादि कार्यक्रमेषु भागमूढाः इति वार्ता।

title: Dainandini
description:
एकैश्वर्ये स्थितोऽपि प्रणतबहुफले यः स्वयं कृत्तिवासाः कान्तासंमिश्रदेहोऽप्यविषयमनसां यः परस्ताद्यतीनाम्। </br>
अष्टाभिर्यस्य कृत्स्नम् जगदपि तनुभिर्बिभ्रतो नाभिमानः सन्मार्गालोकनाय व्यपनयतु स वस्तामसीं वृत्तिमीशः॥ १॥</br>
The Lord, though endowed with magnificent powers that bestows manifold fruits to his devotees, is himself clad only in an elephant-hide; though his body is united with his beloved (Pārvatī). He is yet the foremost of the ascetics, whose mind is unaffected by the sense-objects (of desire); though He supports the entire universe with His eight forms, He is yet devoid of pride (or arrogance). Let (that) Lord Śiva dispel your tendency of tamas (darkness, ignorance) to behold the righteous path.

title: Dainandini
description:
कामधेनुगुणा विद्या ह्यकाले फलदायिनी। प्रवासे मातृसदृशी विद्या गुप्तं धनं स्मृतम्॥ </br>
kāmadhenuguṇā vidyā hyakāle phaladāyinī | pravāse mātṛsadṛśī vidyā guptaṁ dhanaṁ smṛtam ||</br>
The knowledge is like a holy Kamadhenu cow. It bears fruit in all seasons. It is like a mother in foreign land. Hence it is considered a secret treasure.
